loans.name: Sooula

texts.en:
Sooula is 55 years old and a widow with 4 children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Sooula needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Sooula will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose.

loans.name: Katie

texts.en:
Katie is 27 years old and single, with 1 child. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. 

Katie needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, seedlings, a watering hose, a crowbar and gloves. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. 

She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a spade, seedlings, a watering hose, a crowbar and gloves

loans.name: Faatagi

texts.en:
Faatagi is 63 years old and married with 8 children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro and yams that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 4 years.

Faatagi needs a loan to buy fertilizer, a spade, a new crowbar, a tiller, chemicals, gloves, a new chain-saw and sprayers. She has been a member of SPBD since 2010. 

She will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, a spade, a new crowbar, a tiller, chemicals, gloves, a new chain-saw and sprayers

loans.name: Francine

texts.en:
Francine is a 31-year-old woman who is married with 6 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 2 years of experience with this business. 

Francine has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material.

loans.name: Mohamed

texts.en:
This is 34 year-old Mohamed M.  He is married, and has three children aged 5, 4 and 2 years. One is a school going child. He has three additional dependents, who live with him to help in the business. 

Mohamed M. owns a  business where he earns about SLL 2,000,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Mohamed M. has already received and successfully repaid three loans, and now requires a new loan in order to purchase cartons of door locks, inches, nails, padlocks, planes, polish, files, and binding wire. 

He has started his building project but he was unable to open a shop because of inadequate capital.  He is planning to complete his building project.  This loan will help to increase stock and generate more profit.   He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase cartons of door locks, inches, nails, padlocks, planes, polish, files, and binding wire.

loans.name: Edwin Alexander

texts.es:
Edwin, se dedica a cultivar granos básicos (maíz y frijol), además brinda el servicio de trasporte de carga, don Edwin es casado, vive con su esposa y dos hijos, con su negocio genera ingresos con los que cubre las necesidades de su familia, tiene  una experiencia de 25 años, sus labores inician a las cinco de la mañana y finalizan a las cuatro de la tarde, heredo de su familia el oficio y por el momento no representa dificultades.
Está solicitando un préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que eliminara la maleza y dará un buen desarrollo a sus cultivos, espera tener una buena cosecha para tener más granos para alimentar a su familia y satisfacer la demanda de los clientes, los riesgos son los cambios climáticos.
Los sueños de don Edwin son expandir su negocio cultivando hortalizas para distribuirlas a nivel oriental del país, con ello podrá contar con ingresos extras para tener un mejor estilo de vida familiar y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Edwin earns his living growing basic grains (corn and beans); he also offers a service transporting goods.  Edwin is married and lives with his wife and two children.  Through his business he earns income to cover the family needs.   

Edwin's work begins at 4 AM.  He inherited the business from his family, and has 25 years experience.  At present, things are not difficult.  He is seeking a loan to buy farm supplies with which to kill weeds and give his crops a good chance to grow.  Edwin hopes for a good harvest so as to have more grains to feed his family and satisfy his customers.  The risks he faces are climactic changes.

Edwin's dream is to expand his business by cultivating fruits and vegetables to distribute in the eastern part of El Salvador.  With that, he could count on extra income for a better quality of life for his family and to pay off his debts.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies to kill weeds and make his crops grow well

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
When her daughter got pregnant, Cynthia started racking her brain about how to help her daughter obtain income and employment while raising her newborn. Cynthia had always wanted to open a learning center to give children somewhere to go after school where they can be safe and productive.

The idea for a daycare followed naturally from that. Before long, Cynthia realized she really enjoyed caring for other people’s children. She has also been inspired by the steely determination of her daughter to succeed in the daycare business and possibly expand the business down the road to serve children with disabilities.

Cynthia will use her Kiva loan to pay the considerable costs associated with licensing and insuring her new daycare center, as well as to purchase supplies and carry out marketing efforts. 

Down the road, Cynthia is still interested in renting a commercial/retail space to give teenagers somewhere to go, but for now she is thankful for Accion and Kiva lenders for giving her and her daughter an opportunity to raise and provide for her new child.

loans.use: to pay the considerable costs associated with licensing and insuring her new daycare center, as well as to purchase supplies and carry out marketing efforts

loans.name: Hector

texts.en:
Hector is a hardworking painting machine. Currently employed by a local painting company and specializing in wall coverings for beauty salons, Hector has plenty of industry experience. 

He has always wanted to take his experience and start his own business, but he lacked access to the capital he needed to get started. After being denied a loan by his local bank, Hector turned to Kiva and Accion as a credit lifeline. 

Hector will use his Kiva loan to pay for licensing costs, insurance, and materials for his new business.

Starting a new business is rarely a straightforward process, as Hector has found. Getting licensed has been full of a lot of paperwork and red tape, which is especially difficult for small businesses like Hector’s. 

Despite this, Hector’s perseverance is clearly evident when he talks about his business. These qualities of grit and determination are what truly separate the successful entrepreneurs from those that fall by the wayside.

loans.use: to pay for licensing costs, insurance, and materials for his new business

loans.name: Faiane

texts.en:
Faiane is 27 years old and single with one child. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cucumbers and cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for a year. 

Faiane needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a tiller, gloves, gum boots and seedlings. She became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital. Faiane will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, new overalls, a tiller, gloves, gum boots and seedlings.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta is 45 years old and married with 4 children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Ruta needs a loan to buy chemicals, seedlings, watering hose, a tiller, a crowbar, new overalls, gloves and insect poison. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Ruta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, seedlings, watering hose, a tiller, a crowbar, new overalls, gloves and insect poison.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is thankful that she was previously granted an 8,000 PHP loan which she used for the operation of her variety store.  Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily personal and household needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 12,000 PHP loan so she can buy groceries, toiletries, beverages and other products to add to her inventory. The more and varied items displayed at her store the better the chance for more sales and income from her store. Her earnings will definitely help sustain her family’s daily needs and children’s education expense. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Susan aims for her variety store to grow so she can send her children to the best school possible. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of their lives and business every week. It is where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay their Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed in her business.

loans.name: Sorepa

texts.en:
Sorepa is 21 years old and unwed with one child. She makes and sells elei (printed material) to earn a living and has been doing this for 2 years. 

Sorepa has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, rubber designs, stencils, material, wooden carved designs, brushes and rollers. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2012 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, rubber designs, stencils, material, wooden carved designs, brushes and rollers.

loans.name: Kabba

texts.en:
This is 50-year-old Kabba. He is married and has three school-going children who are 13, 10, and 7 seven years old, and a 1-year-old baby. 

Kabba owns a business where he earns about SLL 1,150,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of SLL 5,000,000. Kabba requires a loan in order to purchase bundles of plastic shoes. 

He achieved one of his previous plans, which was to buy a piece of land, but he still planning to rent a shop and buy a vehicle. He has also bought a commercial motor bike. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy bundles of plastic shoes, sandals and slippers.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta is 59 years old and a married mother with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur.  

Violeta has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Violeta requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

Violeta has been in this business for five years. In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables to sell on her food stall.

loans.name: Janet

texts.en:
Janet is 45 years old and married with nine children. With three children in school, Janet works very hard to provide for them.

Janet runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Janet has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Janet would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Carlos

texts.en:
Carlos studied industrial engineering in college and when his brother asked him to join his cabinetry business, he left Mexico and came to San Antonio. After two years of working for his brother, the business closed. Over a six-year span, Carlos worked for several companies specializing in woodwork and design. 

“I told myself as soon as I got the chance to start my own business, I would,” Carlos said. “This has been quite an exciting journey.” With 13 years of experience in the industry of woodwork, Carlos is now the proud owner of LYNC Millwork & Design. The name of his business is comprised of the initials of the first names of his wife, two daughters and his own.  He started his business in 2009 and today is building for big clients like the J.W. Marriott San Antonio Hill Country Resort & Spa. LYNC specializes in modern and contemporary kitchen cabinets and furniture made with exotic woods. 

“I was very thankful for my brother asking me to be a part of his business,” Carlos said. “It was only natural that I seek his help and support when starting my own.” With his wife and brother by his side, Carlos is making his mark on the cabinetry business, picking up both commercial and residential clients each day. His brother helps with the woodwork and his wife supports the customers.  Carlos says he also has four contractors that keep him busy and he couldn’t be happier with the way his business is growing. 

Carlos came to Accion Texas Inc. to help him purchase the materials he needs to wrap up current projects. “The best part of my job is seeing my customers walk away happy with something that I have created,” Carlos said.

loans.use: to help purchase materials such as granite, wood, and other special orders.

loans.name: Santos Cecilia

texts.es:
Santos de 31 años de edad, estudió hasta 9º grado, ahora está acompañada y tiene 3 hijas que dependen de ella y solo dos van a la escuela.


  Santos trabaja  en un calzado de zapatos, pero también tiene una venta de ropa, ella decidió trabajar para 
ayudar en los gastos de su familia, y  para que sus hijas tengan lo necesario, el trabajo le queda cerca de su casa y lo realiza en un horario de 8:00 am A 5:00 pm de lunes a domingo.

 
Ella necesita el crédito para comprar ropa y así incrementar su negocio, comprará pantalones cortos, pijamas, blusas, camisetas, calcetas, etc. 

 El sueño de Santos es dedicarse a su negocio siempre para dejar de trabajar en el calzado y así tener mas tiempo que dedicarle a su familia.
texts.en:
Santos is 31 years old and studied up to 9th grade. She now has a life partner and three dependent children, two of whom go to school. She works in footwear but also has a business selling clothing. She decided to go to work so she could help with her family's household expenses and so that her children could have the necessities. 

She works near her house and her hours are from 8:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. from Monday through Sunday. She needs the loan so she can buy clothing and expand her business.  She will buy shorts, pajamas, blouses, undershirts, socks, etc.  Santos dreams of being able to work full time at her own business so she can stop working in footwear and have more time for her family.

loans.use: to buy clothing so she can increase her business. She will buy shorts, pajamas, blouses, undershirts, socks, etc.

loans.name: Malialele

texts.en: Malialele is 29 years old and married with 3 children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 3 years. Malialele needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots (rubber boots) and a spade. She has been a member of SPBD since 2011. Malialele will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Sandra

texts.en: Sandra is a 42-year-old married woman with six children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has four years of experience with this business. Sandra needs a loan to buy pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, bread, coffee, a boiler and cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Sandra has been a member of SPBD since 2010.

loans.use: to buy pies, cakes, snacks, soft drinks, bread, coffee, a boiler and cups

loans.name: Lesa

texts.en: Lesa is a 46-year-old divorced woman with one child. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Lesa needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soy sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Lesa became a member of SPBD this year to gain access to capital.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soy sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Falelua

texts.en: Falelua is a 28-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Falelua needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay her family's weekly expenses. Falelua has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer and yeast

loans.name: Jacinta

texts.en: Jacinta is a 39-year-old single woman with two children. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Jacinta needs a loan to buy a new barbecue grill set, mutton flaps, sausages, cucumbers, potatoes, mayonnaise and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to help with her children's school fees. Jacinta has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a new barbecue grill set, mutton flaps, sausages, cucumbers, potatoes, mayonnaise and paper plates

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes  is 69 years old and married with eight children.

Lourdes  works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

Lourdes  has borrowed and repaid 15 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

Lourdes  aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries like canned goods, snack foods, and other miscellaneous items.

loans.name: Joeffrey

texts.en:
Joeffrey, 51, is a diligent farmer based at Kisii region of Kenya. Joeffrey has sustained his livelihood over the last 5 years through selling milk, eggs and tea produced at his farm. 
Mixed farming is a very common practise among farmers from Kisii. Stanley finds dairy farming, poultry keeping and tea farming to be sustainable and very fulfilling. However, his biggest challenges are the high farming cost.  
Joeffrey is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry. To resolve this challenge, he joined Juhudi Kilimo (a microfinance that finances smallholder farmers) . 
Your loan contribution will enable Joeffrey to afford his highest monthly expenses- farm-related-comfortably  and channel the surplus amount to his children’s education.

loans.use: to purchase poultry

loans.name: Silvia

texts.en:
Hello world, meet Silvia. She is a smallholder farmer from Lelmokwo in  Eldoret, Kenya. She is a mother of three: two sons and one daughter. Like many farmers in the region, she keeps a dairy cow. Eldoret has a thriving market for dairy products. Silvia has sustained herself through dairy farming for seven years now. 

She enjoys the farming lifestyle. She has a connection with farm animals that goes deep to the extent that she names each of them. She has aspirations of expanding her dairy farm but due to financial constraints, she has been unable to do so until now. 

From Kiva lenders, Silvia is borrowing KES 63,100 to purchase a high yielding dairy cow. This cow will boost milk production in the farm. As a result, she will have more quantity for both consumption and sales. With the money from the additional sales, she will be able to service her loan on time.

With increased income from the loan, Silvia plans to spend money to settle the high farming cost of production. Many farmers compromise quality because of the high cost of inputs. However, with increased income, Silvia will not take such measures.

In the long run, her family will realize an improved standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia is 51 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Lilia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Lilia has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, canned goods and other groceries. 

In the future Lilia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Shamim

texts.en:
Shamim, age 45, is a married woman. She deals in the business of selling animals. She buys animals (baby goats & calves) at low prices, raises them and then sells them in the market at higher prices. She makes enough through her business to contribute to the family income. She also sells milk to generate extra income. 

Shamim needs to improve her business to bear her household expenses. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied a loan of PKR 55,000 to purchase more animals. She is very experienced and has good contacts in the market. With this loan, she will definitely expand her business and income level. She is in her sixth loan cycle with good credit history. She dreams of providing a higher standard of living for her five children.

loans.use: to purchase more animals.

loans.name: Sebastian Efrain

texts.es:
Sebastian tiene 34 años de edad, de estado civil soltero, vive con sus hijos de 12, 11 y 7 años vive en el Cantón Echeandia, comunidad Camaron  Provincia de Bolivar.

El se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de platano yuca y a la cria de animales . Solicita el crédito para la compra de cerdos para engorde y luego venderlos. La compra lo realiza en Echeandia. Su meta es comprarse un vehículo. Su desafío es la  influencia del clima y plagas en sus cultivos. En su tiempo libre se dedica a hacer deporte y pasearse.
texts.en:
Sebastian is 34 years old, he is single and he lives with his children who are seven, eleven, and twelve years old. He lives in the Echeandia region, in the Camaron community, in the province of Bolivar.

He makes a living as a farmer, growing bananas, yucca and raising animals. He is requesting the loan to buy pigs to fatten, to then later sell. He will make the purchase in Echeandia. 

His goal is to buy a vehicle. His challenges are the effect the weather and infestations have on his crops. In his spare time he enjoys playing sports and going for walks.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Hajer

texts.en:
Hajer is a young Syrian in her late thirties. She has been living in Lebanon with her husband who works as a driver, and their children for several years and works as a part time make-up artist in a beauty salon. However, her main source of income relies on sewing and repairing clothes. 
She is asking for a 1,543,658 Lebanese pounds loan for the first time from Kiva partner Ibdaa. She plans to use the loan to cover the maintenance expenses for her sewing machine and expand her sewing kit which will help her develop her small business and support her family. 
Hajer's goal is to provide her two children who are 8 and 10 years old with better living conditions and cover their needs under an unstable socio-economic situation.

loans.use: to cover the maintenance costs of her sewing machine

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en:
Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. 

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo. This will help her to increase her sales which will ultimately help in generating more income for her. She is in her third loan cycle with good credit history.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo.

loans.name: Rosa Yanira

texts.es: Rosa de 35 años de edad posee un taller de costuras ubicado en su lugar de residencia desde hace 3 años, vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, Rosa está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar un horno para elaborar pan ya que también tiene una panadería ubicada en su lugar de residencia, pero el horno que tiene no es suficiente para la elaboración,  ya que tiene mucha demanda por que elabora con productos de calidad el pan, por esa razón solicita dicho crédito para poder  comprar el horno y seguir con su trabajo, para tener junto con su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rosa is 35 years old and she has owned a sewing workshop, located in her home, for the past three years. She lives in her own home with her husband and their three children.

Rosa is requesting a loan to be able to buy an oven to make bread, because she also has a bakery in her home, but the oven she has is not adequate. She has a lot of demand due to the high quality of products used in her bread, which is why she is asking for this loan to be able to buy the oven and continue working in order for her and her family to have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy an oven.

loans.name: Faateletala

texts.en:
Faateletala is 74 years old and a widow with eight children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. 

Faateletala needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, pot plants, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow and gloves. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, pot plants, a tiller, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow and gloves

loans.name: Abner

texts.en:
Abner is thankful that he was granted a 30,000 PHP loan that he used to buy spare parts and accessories and for the maintenance of their tricycle unit. Through his earnings, he is able to send his children to school and meet their family's daily household and personal needs.
 
He would like to apply for another loan, 32,000 PHP, as additional working capital to buy spare parts and for the maintenance of his tricycle unit. His earnings help him to sustain their daily needs and the educational expenses of his children. He looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in his heart. 

Abner aims to add more tricycle units so his business will grow to give a better and more comfortable life for his family. He meets up with his co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of his life and business and to also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God he studies.

* All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for spare parts and maintenance of his tricycle (motorcycle with sidecar).

loans.name: Susitina

texts.en:
Susitina is 47 years old and unmarried with three children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Susitina needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a watering hose, new overalls and gum boots. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. She will use the profits from her sales to pay her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a watering hose, new overalls and gum boots

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a very hard-working entrepreneur from Batasan, Quezon City, Philippines. She is 53 years old and has children. She and her husband are working together to provide for their children. She operates a junk shop to provide income for their everyday expenses.

Trash is not actively segregated in the Philippines and while waiting for their local dump trucks, people scavenge garbage dumps and trash bags for recyclable materials like metal, copper, plastic, and papers. They sell these items to junk shops for a little profit. Junk shops then stack, clean, and gather huge quantities of these materials and sell them back to foundries and factories. Marilou's regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. She earns a minimum of PHP 1,000 in sales every day.

To help her continue operation of her business, Marilou is taking out a PHP 15,000 loan. She will be incorporating the loan into her current revolving fund used to buy recyclable materials from collectors.
 
In the future, she dreams of growing her business and hopes that she will be able to provide all their needs. She also hopes to send all her children to school and have them finish their studies. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and also draws strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

*All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: To pay for recyclable materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is 50 years old and married with six children, two of whom are in school.

Perlita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 11,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Perlita has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from farming rice.

Perlita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
The person appearing in the photograph is John. He is a member of Muungano Self Help group. He is 52 years old and married with seven children. He lives with his wife and two of his children, while the other five are living on their own.
 
He is a maize and beans farmer. Part of the produce is used for family consumption, and the rest is for commercial purposes. Having undertaken the Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HIH EA) training on enterprise creation and management, John came up with an idea to start poultry keeping. There is a rise in demand for chicken and eggs in the area. He has applied for a loan that he hopes will boost his poultry business and meet the demand for the indigenous chicken and eggs, thus generating more income. This will make him be in a position to provide for the basic necessities for his two children and wife, i.e., food and education, with ease.
 
John is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support, and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Margarita

texts.en:
Margarita is 55 years old and married with five children.

Margarita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Margarita has borrowed and repaid seven loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for twenty years and also earns an income from farming rice and pig fattening.

Margarita aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sapini

texts.en:
Sapini is 59 years old and married with nine children. She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Sapini needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Sapini will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Violina

texts.en: Violina is a 46-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Violina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Violina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, icing sugar, butter and a large stove.

loans.name: Jose Teodolfo

texts.es:
Jose Teodolfo tiene 41 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rustico, vive con su conyuge y sus dos menores hijos de 7 y 5 años de los cuales el primero cursa primaria en colegio nacional; vive en la parte rural del distrito de San Felipe, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Jose Teodolfo realiza trabajos como maestro de obra en construcción, él realiza construcciones de material noble y de adobe entre otros, Jose Teodolfo cuenta con 8 años de experiencia en el rubro, los trabajos los realiza en su mismo caserio y caserios aledaños. El destino del crédito será para invertir en compra de madera para construcción asi como instrumentos para poder facilitar su trabajo, lo que le generá mayores ingresos y así poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose Teodolfo is 41 years old, he lives in his own home made of rustic materials. He lives with his partner and his two young children who are five and seven years old. One of his children goes to school in a national primary school. He lives in the rural area of the district of San Felipe, in the province of Jaén, region of Cajamarca, in the northern mountain range of Peru.

Jose Teodolfo works as a master builder in construction. He works with high-quality materials and sun-dried brick, among others. Jose Teodolfo has eight years experience in this position, and he works in his neighborhood and surrounding areas.

The loan will be to buy wood as a tool to help with his construction work, which will generate a larger income so he will be able to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood as a tool to help with his construction work.

loans.name: Tutaima

texts.en:
Tutaima is a 43-year-old married woman with two children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tutaima needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. 

Tutaima has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, a large frying pan, a new oven, cooking oil, a strainer, and yeast.

loans.name: Mulu

texts.en:
Mulu is 45 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro and bananas that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. 

Mulu needs a loan to buy chemicals, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller, new boots, and a pair of overalls. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2012. Mulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, a crowbar, a new wheelbarrow, crops, a tiller, new boots, and a pair of overalls

loans.name: Vinea

texts.en:
Vinea is 31 years old and single with one child. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. 

Vinea needs a loan to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar, chemicals, a spade, and new boots. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2014. Vinea will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, a wheelbarrow, a machete, a crowbar, chemicals, a spade, and new boots

loans.name: Amelita

texts.en:
Amelita is thankful that she was granted a 12,000 PHP loan that she used to purchase quantities of raw materials like fabric, thread and other materials needed in her business. Through her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 15,000 PHP loan as additional working capital to buy additional supplies of raw materials like fabrics and threads needed in her business. Her earnings from business will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and children’s education. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Amelita hopes to grow her tailoring business and dreams of a more comfortable and decent life with her family. She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week, and draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and from the Word of God she studies.

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for fabric, thread, needles and other materials needed in her business.

loans.name: Sabita

texts.en:
Sabita is a 43-year-old woman from a remote region of Jalpaiguri district. She is married, a housewife, and a mother of three children (one son and two daughters). She is married to Dilip, 60 years old, a car driver by profession. Sabita could not complete her secondary education and her husband attended school until grade six. Her children are grown up.  Her son is also a car driver.

Sabita's husband and son have no fixed income.  So it is difficult to meet all the basic needs with their inconsistent income. So to earn for the family, Sabita is associated with the business of making incense sticks. She has been operating this business for the last six years. She makes incense sticks. She works hard the whole day for their family. Now she needs to invest money to grow her business to cope with their present economic situation when prices of essential commodities are increasing daily. It is a very profitable business in her area and does not involve much labor cost.

Sabita has applied for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner) in order to extend her business. She wants to purchase raw materials (bamboo sticks, sandalwood powder, glue etc.) for making incense.  She will sell them at the market as well as door to door to her neighbors for more profit. There is a high demand for this product in her locality. She hopes it will improve the family's financial condition. She wants to further improve her business to give the family economic stability.

She is grateful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more raw materials for her incense making business.

loans.name: Epenesa

texts.en:
Epenesa is a 57-year-old woman who is married with seven children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has four years of experience with this business. 

Epenesa has requested a loan to buy material, a new sewing machine, threads, needles, a pair of scissors, and a measuring tape. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. 

She joined South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) in 2010 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, a new sewing machine, threads, needles, a pair of scissors, and a measuring tape

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va, a 32-year-old married mother of two, has been operating a small bakery in her community to earn a living for six years now. A member of SPBD since 2008, Va is requesting a loan to buy flour, sugar, a large stove, yeast, baking powder, large basins, cooking oil and a strainer. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar, a large stove, yeast, baking powder, large basins, cooking oil and a strainer

loans.name: Solialofi

texts.en: Solialofi is a 43-year-old married woman with 5 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 10 years of experience with this business. Solialofi needs a loan to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a cash tin and new chairs. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Solialofi has been a member of SPBD since 2004.

loans.use: to buy sandwiches, pies, donuts, snacks, coffee, a large boiler, a cash tin and new chairs

loans.name: Lemalie

texts.en: Lemalie is a 41-year-old single mother with 7 children. She runs a small canteen in her community to earn a living. She has 3 years of experience with this business. Lemalie needs a loan to buy cupcakes, sandwiches, soft drinks, snacks, cup-and-bowl noodles, coffee, sugar, and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses and to help with the expansion of her business. Lemalie has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy cupcakes, sandwiches, soft drinks, snacks, cup-and-bowl noodles, coffee, sugar, and foam cups

loans.name: Joanna

texts.en:
Joanna is thankful that she received a 20,000 PHP loan which she used for the operation of her variety store. With her earnings, she is able to send her children to school and meet her family's household and personal needs.
 
She would like to apply for another 18,000 PHP loan as additional working capital to buy additional groceries, toiletries, and beverages to expand her product inventory. The more items and choices displayed at her store will mean more sales and income. Her earnings will definitely help her to sustain her daily needs and educational expenses of her children. She looks forward to this financial increase with gladness and thankfulness in her heart. 

Joanna dreams that her business will grow bigger and hopes to have a better future.  She meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her life and business every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God she studies.

All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, to build social capital, and to repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for grocery items, toiletries, and beverages needed for her business.

loans.name: Ruta

texts.en:
Ruta, a 27-year-old married mother of three, has a small plantation upon which she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. In business for one year, Ruta, who joined  SPBD this year, needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade. 

Ruta will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots and a spade

loans.name: Rita

texts.en:
Rita hails from Maynaguri. She is 42 years old and a housewife.  She is illiterate and can sign her name only. She is married to Jogesh, who is a 50-year-old farmer.  Together they are raising one son who is grown up.  They could not provide an education for their only son because of their poverty and now he works as a mason. They live at Tekatuli, a remote region in Jalpaiguri district.

Rita's husband does vegetable cultivation. He produces vegetables, such as tomatoes, potatoes, cauliflowers, ladies' fingers, onions, etc., and sells them at the market. Rita helps her husband to sell vegetables at the market. They are very hardworking people with a willingness to improve the financial condition of their family. Whatever they are earning from their businesses is used for their monthly household expenses.

Rita and her husband are now planning to buy standard-quality paddy seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides so she can produce paddy rice and increase her income. Being the staple food, paddy is in great demand by the people of her region.

Thus Rita is asking for a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She is a hardworking and optimistic woman who hopes that with her earnings, she will be able to improve her family's quality of life and continue striving for a better future.

She conveys her thanks to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase farm supplies to grow paddy.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is a 42-year-old married woman living with her family in Khagrabari, in Maynaguri Jalpaiguri. She is an illiterate woman, who can sign her name only.  Due to the miserable condition of her family, Minati was not provided with an education.  She is married to Garen, and is blessed with a lovely daughter. Her daughter is a student of grade 10.

Minati's husband is a trader of electronic appliances. He studied till grade 2, so he could not get any respectable job. As a result of the miserable condition inside his family at that time, he tried to find any business to look after his family. Somehow he accumulated money to start his own business selling many kinds of accessories and simple electrical appliances in a small store. He has been running his business for more than seven years. He is a man of strong determination, which changed his life to the best. His business is located in the local market and he has a lot of customers. His profits from his business are good. Minati also help her husband in his work.

For further expanding her husband's business, Minati applied for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use this money to increase her husband's business through purchasing many kinds of electronic accessories and simple electrical goods (wire, bulbs, tube light, fan, cords etc.) for his store in order to meet all the demands of the customers.

Minati expects that the loan will help her husband to expand his business and will strengthen the economic condition of her family for which she is much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase electrical appliances for her husband's business.

loans.name: Tupe

texts.en:
Tupe is 61 years old and married with five children. She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for three years. 

Tupe needs a loan to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and gloves. 

She has been a member of South Pacific Business Development (SPBD) since 2011. Tupe will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy chemicals, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gum boots, and gloves

loans.name: Toese

texts.en:
Toese is a 51-year-old married woman with four children. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Toese needs a loan to buy a large cooler, rubber gloves, cordials, a chest freezer and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family’s weekly expenses. 

Toese has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a large cooler, rubber gloves, cordials, a chest freezer, and foam cups.

loans.name: Jose Guadalupe

texts.es: Jose de 33 años de edad se dedica al cultivo de hortalizas desde hace varios años, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, jose vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus tres hijos, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra  fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno donde cultiva las hortalizas que es el que muestra en la fotografía, y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos y darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jose, aged 33, has been making a living growing vegetables for a number of years. He sells his products at the various markets near his home. With the income he obtains from his sales, he manages to cover some of his household expenses.

Jose lives in his own house, with his wife and three children. He is requesting a loan to buy inorganic and organic fertilizers, pest control products, and the like, and to improve the field where he grows the vegetables, which is shown in the picture. In this way, he will be able to continue growing his crops and give his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy inorganic and organic fertilizers, pest control products, and the like, and to improve the field where he grows vegetables.

loans.name: Martha Socorro

texts.es:
Martha de 48 años de edad, solo estudió hasta 7º grado pues era la mayor de 7 hermanos y tuvo que trabajar, está casada y su esposo trabaja como seguridad privada, tiene tres hijos de los cuales 2 están viviendo con ella, además de su suegra por lo que son 3 personas que dependen de ella.
	

Martha actualmente trabaja en la agricultura y lo ha hecho toda su vida pues lo aprendió de sus padres, además de la agricultura ella tiene crianza de gallinas, se traslada 2 kilómetros a pie para llegar a donde tiene la parcela, le ayuda su esposo y un hijo y a las 4:00 pm que regresa a su casa realiza  las labores del hogar.


El dinero del préstamo será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto, ella actualmente tiene ganado y necesita invertir mas en el negocio y  ha visto que si tiene ganancia en dicha actividad.


Los sueños de Martha son poder darle el estudio necesario a sus hijos para que ellos puedan tener una mejor oportunidad en la vida y tener mas fuerte su negocio para obtener mayores ingresos económicos.
texts.en:
Martha is 48 years old. She only studied until the 7th grade because she was the oldest of 7 siblings and had to work. She is married, and her husband works as a private security guard. She has three children, 2 of whom live with her in addition to her mother-in-law, which makes three people who depend on her.

Martha currently works in agriculture. She has done it her whole life, since she learned it from her parents. In addition to agriculture, she raises hens. She travels 2 kilometers on foot to get to where she has her plot of land. Her husband and one son help her. When she arrives home at 4:00 pm, she does the house work.

The loan money will be used to buy free-range cattle. She currently has cattle and needs to invest more in the business. She has seen that she earns money in this business.

Martha's dreams are to be able to give her children the necessary education so that they can have a better opportunity in life, and to make her business stronger in order to get better income.

loans.use: to buy free-range cattle.  She currently has cattle and needs to invest more in the business.  She has seen that she earns money in this business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain her mill and to fix up the shop where she has her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy crates of assorted drinks, a gross of cigarettes, cartons of tinned milk and other goods

loans.name: Kalala

texts.en:
Kalala is a 36-year-old unmarried woman with one child. She makes and sells Samoan fried chips in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Kalala needs a loan to buy bananas and taro, a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, and seasoning. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Kalala has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bananas and taro, a barrel of cooking oil, a large frying pan, a new oven, and seasoning

loans.name: Katarina

texts.en:
Katarina is a 36-year-old woman who is married with four children. She has a small bingo business in her community to earn a living. She has one year with this business. 

Katarina needs a loan to buy bingo bottles, a large bingo machine, bingo cards, tables, and chairs. She will use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Katarina joined SPBD in 2014 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy bingo bottles, a large bingo machine, bingo cards, tables, and chairs

loans.name: Pulu

texts.en:
Pulu is 51 years old and a widow with four children. 
 
She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages and tomatoes that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for one year. Pulu needs a loan to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, new boots and a pair of overalls.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2014. Pulu will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, chemicals, sprayers, a tiller, a crowbar, new boots and a pair of overalls

loans.name: Imeleta

texts.en: Imeleta is 52 years old and married with five children. She owns and operates a small store selling a variety of items. She has been doing this for one year. Imeleta needs a loan to buy a new display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, a sack of onions and a bag of sugar. She hopes to use her profits to pay for the renovation of her house and help pay for her children's education. She became a member of SPBD in 2014 to gain access to capital for her business.

loans.use: to buy a new display fridge, snacks, frozen goods, canned food, onions and sugar

loans.name: Pelenatete

texts.en:
Pelenatete is a 25 year old married woman with four children. She makes and sells pancakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Pelenatete needs a loan to buy bags of flour, a frying pan, cooking oil, sugar, yeast, an oven and trays. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Pelenatete has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, a frying pan, cooking oil, sugar, yeast, an oven, and trays

loans.name: Laufofoga

texts.en: Laufofoga is 41 years old and married with four children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for six years. Laufofoga has requested a loan to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, a cutter and gloves. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2008 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy material, fabric paint, stencils, brushes, rollers, rubber designs, a cutter and gloves

loans.name: Luaipou

texts.en:
Luaipou is 34 years old and married with two children. 

She has a small plantation where she grows taro that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for two years. Luaipou needs a loan to buy crops, sprayers, gloves, new boots, a wheelbarrow, a tiller and a machete. 

She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Luaipou will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy crops, sprayers, gloves, new boots, a wheelbarrow, a tiller and a machete

loans.name: Selesetina

texts.en:
Selesetina is a 28-year-old married woman with five children. She runs a small business making sweet buns in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Selesetina needs a loan to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Selesetina has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy bags of flour, sugar, yeast, cooking oil, baking trays, butter and a large stove

loans.name: Paipai

texts.en:
Paipai is 25 years old and unmarried with two children. 

She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for five years. Paipai needs a loan to buy a watering hose, chemicals, new boots, overalls, sprayers, insect poison and seedlings.
 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2009. Paipai will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy a watering hose, chemicals, new boots, overalls, sprayers, insect poison and seedlings

loans.name: Tasi

texts.en:
Tasi is a 20-year-old unmarried woman with no children. She runs a small bakery in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. 

Tasi needs a loan to buy a large stove, mixer, bags of flour, sugar, trays, and baking powder. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Tasi has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy a large stove, a mixer, bags of flour, sugar, trays, and baking powder

loans.name: Rodolfo

texts.es: Rodolfo de 49 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el posee desde hace varios años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la variedad de productos que comercializa y por los buenos precios, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir algunos gastos que se le presentan en su hogar,  Rodolfo está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería  como: aceite, huevos, azúcar,  granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. para surtir su negocio y así poder tener junto con su esposa una mejor calidad de vida sin limitación alguna.
texts.en:
Rodolfo is 49 years old and lives in his own house with his wife. For a number of years he has had a small store which is located in his house. Thanks to his variety of products and low prices he has many customers. He is able to cover some of his household expenses with the money he earns from this business.

Rodolfo is asking for a loan to buy more merchandise such as oil, eggs, sugar, basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, etc. to stock up his business and  have a better quality of life with his wife, without limitations.

loans.use: to buy oil, eggs, sugar, basic grains, snacks, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Maulupe

texts.en: Maulupe is a 19-year-old single woman with one child. She makes and sells ice cakes in her community to earn a living. She has one year of experience with this business. Maulupe needs a loan to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new freezer chest, Chinese candy and foam cups. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. Maulupe has been a member of SPBD since 2014.

loans.use: to buy cordials, sugar, a large cooler, a new  freezer chest, Chinese candy and foam cups

loans.name: Uaine

texts.en:
Uaine is a 22-year-old unmarried woman with two children. She makes and sells barbecue in her community to earn a living. She has three years of experience with this business. 

Uaine needs a loan to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soy sauce, onions and paper plates. She plans to use her profits to pay for her children's education. Uaine has been a member of SPBD since 2011.

loans.use: to buy mutton flaps, sausages, chicken leg quarters, soy sauce, onions and paper plates

loans.name: Vaituutuu

texts.en:
Vaituutuu is 50 years old and married with six children. She makes and sells elei printed material to earn a living and has been doing this for five years. 

Vaituutuu has requested a loan to buy fabric paint, a cutter, wooden carved designs, rubber designs, stencils, and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her family's weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2009 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy fabric paint, a cutter, wooden carved designs, rubber designs, stencils, and material

loans.name: Gad

texts.en:
Gad is a 40-year-old man, married with five children, with three attending school. He does boda boda (motorcycle transport) as his major source of income.  He started business in 2010 so that he would be able to get income to meet his family's financial needs. His major challenge is lack of enough capital to buy building materials to complete his house. 

Gad joined Ugafode to get financial assistance to as to complete his house since his business alone could not meet all his financial needs. So he took a loan of 1,500,000 to complete his house. Gad is thankful to Kiva and UGAFODE for the financial support rendered to him which would enable him to complete his first house and sustain his business. Completing the house will help him to cut down on the cost of rent and that money can be used to grow the business.

loans.use: To buy cement, shutters and paint

loans.name: Juliet

texts.en:
Juliet is 34 years old and lives in Katipunan, Guipos, ZDS. She is married with two children.                     

Juliet has a shop that sells rice and grocery products. She has had this business for five years. She requested a loan to pay for 10 sacks of rice and grocery products.                                                           

Juliet has been a member of PMPC for six years. In the future, Juliet hopes to have a mini-grocery store.

loans.use: To pay for 10 sacks of rice and grocery products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy perfumes, creams, deodorant, and lotions as well as plated chains, bracelets and earrings at wholesale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more chicks for his barn

loans.name: Sokhom

texts.en:
Sokhom is a 35-year-old mother of five dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a remote area of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she grows rice and sells the crops to local dealers. She is an active and honest rice farmer who can make a net profit of around USD 7.00 a day.

Sokhom wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by building a latrine. She has therefore requested a loan from KIVA for that purpose. A latrine will give her family members access to sanitation, promote their health, and help lessen environmental deterioration. 

Sokhom is thankful for the loan opportunity granted through HKL, which offers a much lower interest rate than other available general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
Cesar tiene 28 años de edad, es soltero, sin carga familiar, vive con su tia, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande, en la zona urbana de Cayalti y goza con buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos; dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Cesar se dedica a la actividad de compra y venta de huevos al por menor, desde hace más de 1 año, estas ventas las realiza en su propio domicilio. él solicita préstamo para la compra de mercaderia por mayor (huevos). De esta manera hacer crecer su negocio, obtener más ingresos y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Cesar is 28 years old, single, and without a family to support. He lives with his aunt in his own home in a large community in the city of Cayalti. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. His community is located in the Chiclayo province, in the Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. 

For over a year, Cesar has made a living buying wholesale eggs and selling them out of his home. He is requesting a loan to purchase more wholesale eggs. In doing so, he will be able to grow his business, increase his income, and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy eggs at wholesale price to then sell, which will grow his business.

loans.name: Kumush

texts.ru: Кумуш 39 лет, замужем, воспитывает 2 детей, старшая дочь учится в университете, младший сын - в школе. Основной деятельностью Кумуш является торговля продуктами питания в арендованном магазине в центре города. В этом деле ей помогает муж. Бизнес Кумуш начала с 25,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря непосильному труду и емкой работе Кумуш, она достигла больших успехов в развитии хозяйства и стала получать ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кумуш обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение продукции в обороте и расширения ассортимента. Доходы от кредита Кумуш планирует вложить в дальнейшее увеличение поголовья скота в своем хозяйстве.
texts.en: Kumush is 39, married, and has two children. Her older daughter is studying at university and her younger son is in high school. Her main business is a grocery store and she rents a space in the center of town. Her husband helps her with the store, which she started with 25,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her significant and difficult labor, Kumush has made great progress in developing her business and now earns 25,000 som (KGS) per month. In order to continue developing her business, she applied for a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with Bai-Tushum Bank to help her increase her inventory and offer a larger variety of products in her store. She plans to use her profits to invest in livestock on her farm.

loans.use: To buy grocery products in order to increase her inventory and offer a larger variety of products in her store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: Saul Antonio

texts.es:
Saúl, es acompañado, vive con su compañera de vida y sus cinco hijos, sus esfuerzos son enfocados en proveer a su familia de lo que necesiten, con sacrificios ha logrado que todos sean bachilleres; su negocio consiste en trabajar en la agricultura además Saúl cuenta un una pequeña pensión del gobierno por haber pertenecido al ejército, luego que el conflicto armado finalizo empezó a trabajar en el campo para tener más ingresos. 

El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de abono, para dar un buen desarrollo a la platanera que tiene, espera que su cultivo le dure 3 años para tener una mejor producción, mejores ingresos y atraer  nuevos clientes.
Sus proyectos son mantenerse trabajando para cancelar su deuda y salir adelante con su familia.
texts.en:
Saúl lives with his life partner and their five children. His efforts are focused on providing his family with life's necessities. Through his sacrifices, all of his children have completed secondary school. He works as a farmer and in addition, Saúl receives a small pension from the government for having been in the army. Once the armed conflict was over, he began to work in the fields to increase his income.

Saúl will invest the money from the loan in fertilizer so that his banana plantation will flourish.  He hopes that his crops will last 3 years, resulting in better production and better income, and attracting new customers. His projects are to continue to work so he can pay off his debt and get ahead with his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to help his banana plantation flourish.

loans.name: Domingo Soriano

texts.es:
Domingo es una persona muy trabajadora, tiene 55 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Ica junto a su familia.
Desde muy joven apoyó a sus padres en las chacras para sacar adelante a sus hermanos es por ello que ganó bastante experiencia en este sector y hoy se dedica al cultivo de pecana y uva. Actualmente está innovando con el cultivo de plátano y también empezando un pequeño negocio de crianza y comercialización de cerdos. Es una persona que trabaja más de 10 horas diarias porque quiere seguir apoyando a su familia.
Domingo está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá comprar abono orgánico para sus cultivos y realizar el pago a los jornaleros por la limpieza del terreno. De esta manera sus ingresos mejorarán y podrá mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Domingo is a very hard worker. He is 55 years old, single, and lives in Ica with his family. From a young age, he helped his parents in the fields to help with the family income and his siblings. Through this, he gained plenty of experience in this sector, and today he makes a living growing grapes and pecans. He is currently innovating and diversifying his business by growing plantains and by starting a small business of raising and selling pigs. Domingo works more than 10 hours a day, because he wants to continue to support his family.
 
Domingo is very grateful to the Kiva lenders because with their support, he will be able to buy organic fertilizer for his crops, and will be able to pay laborers to clear the land. With this, his income will improve along with his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for his pecan crop, and to pay laborers.

loans.name: Kulmairam

texts.ru: Кулмайрам, 45 лет, замужем, 4 детей. У Кулмайрам среднее образование, с 1995 года в качестве основного дохода занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть корова с телятами, а также 2,22 ГА поливной земли, где она выращивает фасоль. Кулмайрам известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS) от продажи молока, скота и преимущественно от реализации сельскохозяйственной продукции. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Кулмайрам обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS), который направит на сбор урожая, обеспечив работой 15 человек, как односельчан, так и жителей других деревень. Доходы от кредита Кулмайрам планирует использовать для развития своего хозяйства и намерена дать своим детям хорошее образование.
texts.en:
Kulmairam is 45 years old, married and has four children. Kulmairam has secondary education. As a main source of income she has worked with farming since 1995. She has a cow with calves at her farm, as well as 2.22 hectares of irrigated land, on which she grows beans. 

Kulmairam is known as a principled, honest, decent and reliable person. Currently her business brings in a monthly income of 10,000 som (KGS) from selling milk, livestock and particularly from the sale of agricultural products. 

To further develop her business, Kulmairam turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan in the amount of 30,000 som (KGS), which will go to harvesting, providing work for 15 people, both villagers and inhabitants of other villages. Kulmairam plans to use the income from the loan to develop her business and intends to give her children a good education.

loans.use: to hire workers to harvest beans

loans.name: Turbat

texts.en: Mrs. Turbat, 55 years old, lives with her two daughters in Darkhan, second largest city of Mongolia. After her retirement, she began her business of carpet cleaning. Her elder daughter works as a janitor at the city library. Her younger daughter studies at university. She is requesting a loan of 3000 USD to pay the tuition fee of her younger daughter. As the academic year is beginning, paying the tuition fee has become an urgent issue as she has no cash at the moment.

loans.use: to pay her daughter's tuition fee

loans.name: Oyungerel

texts.en:
Mrs. Oyungerel, 45 years old, lives with her husband and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been working as a janitor at a hospital since 2013. Her husband renders taxi service to local people. Their daughter studies at university. 

After her daughter completed her secondary school and advanced to university, her family migrated to Ulaanbaatar from the countryside. They live in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Oyungerel is requesting a loan of 500,000 MNT to pay the tuition fee for her daughter. With the new academic year beginning, she wants her daughter to study without worrying about tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay university tuition fee

loans.name: Yahya

texts.en:
Yahya is a 23-year-old single man from a village near Nablus city. He lives with his parents and 4 brothers and sisters. His father is a taxi driver, where he gets a good income but not stable. Yahya opened his own business three years ago, which sells roasted nuts in the village. It is a good income and the demand is high. 

Yahya has requested a loan from FATEN, which will help him to buy more inventory for his store. By taking this loan, he will be able to increase his sales and also his income.

Yahya appears at work in the photo.

loans.use: to buy more inventory for his store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more products for his perfume store.

loans.name: Jursun

texts.ru: Журсун успешно погасила предыдущий кредит по линии КИВА и вновь обратилась в Банк "Бай – Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS). С 2013 года она занимается торговлей продуктами питания, в павильоне, который открыла у себя дома. Ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 24,000 сом (KGS). Также в ее семье пополнение, Журсун родила дочь. Расширение товарооборота, а соответственно и увеличение прибыли поможет Журсун накопить средства на дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и покупку автомобиля для семьи.
texts.en:
Jursun successfully paid back her previous Kiva loan and again turned to the bank "Bai Tushum" for a loan of the amount of 60,000 som (KGS). 

Jursun has worked with selling food products at a pavilion at her home since 2013. The monthly income is on average 24,000 som (KGS). She has also increased her family, as she has given birth to a daughter. Expanding her turnover, and consequently increase her income, helps Jursun save money for further developing her business and purchase a vehicle for her family.

loans.use: To purchase food items for selling, in order to increase the assortment in her shop

loans.name: Akanisi

texts.en: Akanisi is a 46 year old woman who is married with 5 children. She runs a small tailoring business in her community. She has 13 years of experience with this business. Akanisi has requested a loan to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material. She plans to use her profits to pay for her families weekly expenses. She joined SPBD in 2001 to gain access to financial services.

loans.use: to buy a new sewing machine, thread, needles, a measuring tape, a new pair of scissors and material

loans.name: Sinath

texts.en:
Sinath is a 32-year-old woman and she has three dependent children who are currently in school. She lives in a small village of Battambang Province, Cambodia. To make a living and support her family, she grows rice and sells the crops to the local dealers. She is an active and honest rice farmer who can make a net profit of around 5 US dollars a day.

Sinath wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is taking a loan through KIVA to build a latrine and buy the necessary equipment. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for this loan, which was granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to increase her capital and buy a large quantity of dry cassava (1000kg) to resell to earn more

loans.name: Manulelei

texts.en:
Manulelei is 32 years old and unmarried with 4 children. 
She has a small vegetable garden where she grows cabbages that she can sell in her community or at the market. She has been doing this for 2 years. Manulelei needs a loan to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose. 
She has been a member of SPBD since 2012. Manulelei will use the profits from her sales to pay for her family's weekly expenses.

loans.use: to buy insect poison, fertilizer, a new wheelbarrow, a tiller, a rake, new gloves and a watering hose

loans.name: Khash-Erdene

texts.en:
Mr. Khash-Erdene, 24 years old, lives with his two brothers in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi service to local people since 2010. He and his brothers used to live with their grandmother who has passed away. One of his brothers studies at university while the other one goes to high school. 

He is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement and fiberglass for house renovation. The house they live in has been deteriorating over the years. After renovation, his brothers will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned and fewer pollutants released.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Rustam

texts.ru: Рустам выходец из района Муминобод, ему 43 года. Он имеет среднее специальное образование, по профессии Рустам является электросварщиком. Однако в течение 20 лет он занимался только торговым бизнесом. Жена Рустама занимается разведением скотов. У Рустама четверо детей, все они в настоящий момент учатся. Один сын Рустама в этом году сдал свои документы в Таджикский Национальный Университет и успешно сдал экзамены. Он будет учится в факультете "Экономика и управление" в дневном отделении. Его годовой контракт составляет около 1500 долларов США. У Рустама нет такого сбережения, но он очень хочет, чтобы его сын учился в ВУЗе и получил высшее образование. Поэтому Рустам обратился за кредитом. Он обещает выплачивать кредит в срок за счет своего бизнеса. Он надеется на поддержку.
texts.en:
Rustam comes from the Muminobod region. He is 43 years old. He has vocational education; he is a welder by profession. However, for a period of 20 years he has worked in retail. Rustam's wife breeds livestock. 

Rustam has four children. All are currently studying. One of Rustam's sons sent his documents to the Tajik National University this year, and successfully passed his entrance exams. He will study full-time at the faculty of Economy and Management. His one-year fee is around 1,500 US dollar.
