texts.es: Karla de 36 años de edad vive en casa familiar con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos es una persona trabajadora y muy responsable, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de tortillas, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, tiene mucha clientela por la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, con lo que gana de sus ventas logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Karla solicita un crédito para la compra de maíz por quintales y cal y así obtener mejores ganancias para darle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Karla is 36 years old. She lives in a family house with her life's companion and their two children. She is a hardworking and very responsible person. She works making and selling tortillas. She has her business in her residence. She has a lot of customers because she is very friendly when she is selling. With what she earns from her sales, she is able to cover her household needs. Karla is asking for a loan to buy corn by the quintal and lime. This way, she can obtain better profits to give her family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn by the quintal as well as lime.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase other goats to raise and sell.

loans.name: Jackelin

texts.es: Jackelin desde muy niña soñó con tener su propio negocio, por eso poco a poco ahorró y adicionó a sus ahorros, el dinero que su esposo le regaló, con el cual emprendió su propia aventura empresarial. Este apoyo fue muy importante y cuando hace dos años decidió iniciar su idea de negocios lo hizo muy felíz, vendiendo ropa accesorios y mercancía variada a crédito entre vecinos y amigos, con los cuales ha multiplicado su clientela. Hoy trabaja de lunes a domingos sin descanso desde  las 8 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde; jeans, pantalones clásicos, camisetas y blusas, conforman su oferta de productos.Su meta es mejorar la imagen y las ventas,  para lograr mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, conformada por su esposo y sus tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 años. Ante su desafío de lograr fuente de financiación para reinvertir, se ha acercado a la Fundación Mario  Santo Domingo,  para obtener un crédito. Este es el primer financiamiento que hace a esta organización, mediante la que comprará ropa, jeans, bolsos, y camisetas, las cuales venderá como de costumbre a crédito a su clientela conformada por vecinos y amigos que estos le han referido. Con su credikiva logrará mejorar sus inventarios para impactar sus ventas y esto es justamente el éxito de su inversión.
texts.en:
Ever since Jackelin was a girl she dreamed of having her own business.  Little by little, she saved.  She put her savings together with the money that her husband gave her, and she undertook her own business adventure.

This support was very important.  Two years ago, when she decided to start her business idea, it made her very happy.  She sells clothes, accessories, and various merchandise on credit to her neighbors and friends.  With these customers her clientele has multiplied.

She now works Mondays through Sundays without rest from eight in the morning until six in the evening.  The products that she offers are jeans, pants, and classic shirts and blouses.

Her goal is to improve the image and the sales.  She will do this in order to manage to improve her family’s quality of life.  Her family is comprised of her husband and their three children between the ages of 10 and 15.

Facing the challenge of getting a source of financing in order to reinvest, she has come to the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to get a loan.  It is the first loan that she is getting from this organization.  She will use the loan to buy clothes like jeans, bags, and t-shirts.  She will sell them as she usually does on credit to her clientele.  Her customers are her neighbors and friends who have referred her.  With her Kiva loan she will manage to improve her inventory in order to impact her sales.  This is exactly the success of her investment.

loans.use: to buy clothes like jeans, bags, and t-shirts.

loans.name: Barnabas

texts.en:
“Don't give me a fish. Teach me to fish. This loan will be my fishing net, my future,” says Barnabas, an eloquent speaker with a strong, commanding manner. He resides in Kilibwoni, a remote village in the lush hills of Nandi hills, in the Rift Valley of Kenya. 

As the key breadwinner of his family, with a beautiful wife and three children, he has been practicing mixed farming for the past 44 years. Because of the immense knowledge he has of farming, he commands a lot of respect from other farmers in his village. His primary source of income have been milk, eggs, and tea. 

He also engages in a small business to supplement the meager income he earns through farming. Although he has been making profits from farming, he has identified a “niche market” for selling cereals; the only big challenge he faces is lack of funds. He is requesting a loan to buy cereals. He intends to buy different varieties of cereals; that is, maize, sorghum, rice, wheat, barley, and millet, to sell in the local market. 

Market for the cereals is never a problem because the demand is always high, and he plans to take advantage of that. Because of the good relationship he has with his neighbors, he plans to increase his market by using word of mouth to reach more customers and markets.

Barnabas is an inspiration to many farmers in his village. He plans that, through accumulated profits, he will be able to buy a milling machine for grinding maize. Through this loan, Barnabas’ life will take another turn, and he will be able to secure the future of his children.

loans.use: to buy cereals to sell in the local market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase many kinds of curtains to sell in his business.

loans.name: Grupo Pasin Group

texts.es:
En Suchitepéquez existe una variedad de negocios donde la gente puede escoger donde consumir sus necesidades diarias.  Pero lo importante no es la cantidad de consumo sino la calidad de esos servicios al cliente. Maria mujer de 22 años de edad  tiene dos hijos los cuales son buenos estudiantes de la escuela de la comunidad. Ella es una mujer emprendedora que esta decidida a seguir luchando por el bienestar de su familia hacia el futuro. (Maria es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía)
Ella  se ha dedicado, con su tienda de abarroterías, servir al público con una calidad de servicio.  Se necesita una vocación especial para ello y Maria lo tiene porque es una de las negociantes más buscadas en su negocio. Ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 5 años y le ha generado muy buena ganancia para ella y su familia para mejorar las condiciones de vida.
Ella es un claro ejemplo en la comunidad donde ella vive y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se ha reunida a ella para emprender juntas el negocio para que ellas también mejoren las condiciones de vida de sus familias.
El uso respectivo que ella dará al préstamo es para la compra de más mercadería para tener surtido su tiene de abarrotería para no perder la clientela ya que para ella es muy importante porque por medio de ello puede tener un ingreso económico par el sostenimiento de su familia.
Dos razones le han motivado para solicitar  un préstamo: ampliar su negocio de abarrotería por la cantidad de clientes que le buscan y la necesidad que tiene de construir una casa para sus dos hijos y es uno de los más grandes sueños de Maria.
texts.en:
En Suchitepéquez there is a variety of business where people can choose to consume their daily needs. However, the important thing isn't the quantity of consumption but the quality of the service for the customer. Maria is 22 years old. She has two children who are good students in the community school. She is an enterprising woman who is determined to keep fighting for the well being of her family in the future. (Maria is the 1rst from the left in the photograph).  

With her grocery store, she has worked serving the public with a quality service. A special vocation is needed for this and Maria has it because she is one of the more popular businesswomen in her business. She has been doing this activity for 5 years and it has generated good income for her and her family to improve their quality of life. 

She is a clear example in the community where she lives and that is why a group of women has met with her to start their businesses so that they can also improve their and their families' living conditions. The respective use she will give the loan is to buy more merchandise to have her store stocked so she won't lose customers. This is very important for her because with this she can have income to support her family. Two reasons have motivated her to ask for this loan: to expand her grocery business with more customers seeking her out as well as to build a house for her two children. This is one of Maria's biggest dreams.

loans.use: to buy grocery merchandise.

loans.name: Xalida

texts.en:
Xalida is a 54-year-old widow with three children. She is trying to raise her children without feeling the absence of their father too much. The main source of the family’s income is gardening. She has been raising and selling wheat for 34 years and has good skills in this area. Her monthly income is 180 AZN.

There is a high demand for wheat because people use it to prepare flour and flour products. They bake pies, bread, lavash, cakes, and so on.  

The family’s monthly income doesn’t cover the demands, and Xalida needs money for this. She applied for a 1,500 AZN loan in order to buy new fertilizers for wheat and increase her harvest and income. She wants to provide her children with a good education.

loans.use: to buy new fertilizers for wheat.

loans.name: Hael

texts.en: Hael applied for a Youth loan last year from Kiva lenders to purchase goods and food materials for his grocery. That loan helped him very much to increase the capital of his grocery. He is very thankful for Kiva lenders for their first loan. After Hael finished repaying all of the installments of the first loan, he has applied for a second Youth loan of 100,000 YER from Kiva lenders to increase and enlarge his business more by purchasing another amount of food materials, soft drinks, and mineral water for his grocery. He hopes to get this loan from Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase food materials, soft drinks, and mineral water for his grocery store.

loans.name: Aissatou Kolda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Aissatou Kolda (debout à l’extrême droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est âgée 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère  d’une fille et d’un garçon. Elle est  très enthousiasme, et s’active dans la vente de poisson frais qu’elle achète dans les marchés au poisson de la région sud pour la revente au marché de sa commune. Elle maîtrise cette activité à merveille pour l’avoir pratiqué depuis plus de 10 ans.

Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter du poisson frais par caisse de 30 000 à 60 000 Fr CFA au plus tous les 15 jours pour la revente par détail.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices prendre en charge certains besoins de sa famille : santé, habillement, scolarité et autres.
texts.en:
This group is composed of very dedicated women, who found out about developing good relationships based on solidarity and mutual assistance in addition to their revenue-generating work essentially focused on small-scale businesses since the ’banc villageois’ was created on November 25, 2003. 

Ms. Aissatou Kolda (standing at the far right with a hand raised) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 40 years old and a married mother of a girl and a boy. She is very enthusiastic and active in selling fresh fish, which she purchases at the fish markets in the south and then resells in her commune’s market.  She has a wonderful mastery of this business for having practiced it for over ten years. 

Her new loan will enable her to purchase some fresh fish at 30,000 francs CFA at most per case, every two weeks, to be sold retail.

With the profits, she plans on meeting certain needs of her family, such as healthcare, clothing, and schooling.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish every two weeks to resell

loans.name: Angelita

texts.en: Angelita works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell used clothing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers. Angelita has been in this business for 20 years now. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more used clothing to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Arleen

texts.en:
Arleen is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arleen is 33 years old and has three children who are in school.

Arleen has a frozen food vending business in the Philippines. Arleen requested a PHP 18,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more packs of frozen food to sell.

Arleen has been in this business for five years. In the future Arleen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more packs of frozen food to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase different kinds of motorcycle spare parts and engine oils to sell in his store.

loans.name: Aitbubu

texts.ru: Айтбубу 50 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Айтбубу высшее педагогическое образование, с 2008 года она стала заниматься сельским хозяйством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Айтбубу есть 3 коровы, также на собственном земельном наделе занимается садоводством, выращивая кукурузу, абрикосы, яблони, вишни. Экологически чистая и вкуснейшая продукция пользуется большим спросом и приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 25,000 сомов(KGS). Яблоки и абрикосы Айтбубу сушит, делая из них сухофрукты и продает их зимой. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Айтбубу обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрений, оплату услуг наемных рабочих. В этом году урожай кукурузы и других сельхоз культур выдался на славу, поэтому и в будущем Айтбубу планирует направлять доходы от кредита на развитие полеводческой деятельности.
texts.en:
Aitbubu is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a teaching degree, but she has been involved in crop farming since 2008.  Today she owns three cows and she also grows corn, apricots, apples and cherries on her own plot of land.  Her organic and delicious crops are in high demand and allow her to make a monthly income of 25,000 som (KGS). Aitbubu uses her apples and apricots to make dried fruits for resale in the winter.  

In order to further develop her farming business, Aitbubu has turned to the bank Bai Tushum & Partners and requested a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers and to hire labor.  This year was an excellent year for corn and other produce, so Aitbubu plans to use her future earnings from this loan to further grow her farming business.

loans.use: to harvest organic fruits and vegetables and buy fertilizers to grow more organic products.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 25 novembre 2003 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce, de bonnes relations  basées sur la solidarité et l’entre aide.

Madame Aïssatou (assise au milieu en boubou bleu et blanc avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette du groupe. Elle est âgée de 45 ans, mariée et mère 02  garçons. Elle est vendeuse fruits plus particulièrement de banane, elle fait aussi de la transformation de pâte d’arachide. Elle achète sa marchandise pour l’arachide lors de marché hebdomadaire et la banane au prés de commerçants intermédiaire. Elle a une bonne expérience de ce commerce pour l’avoir pratiqué pendant des années.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter de la banane le kilo à 175 Fr CFA et 04 sacs d’arachide à 10 000 Fr CFA le sac.

En plus de renforcer son épargne pour bénéficier de prêt plus important, elle compte soutenir son mari dans la gestion  des frais scolaires de leurs enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of very dedicated women, who found out about developing good relationships based on solidarity and mutual assistance in addition to their revenue-generating work essentially focused on small-scale businesses since the ’banc villageois’ was created on November 25, 2003. 

Ms. Aïssatou (sitting in the middle with a hand raised and wearing a blue and white boubou) is the featured borrower of this group. She is 45 years old and a married mother of two boys. She is a fruit vendor, especially bananas. She also produces peanut butter. She purchases her peanuts during the weekly market and her bananas, from middlemen. She has good experience in this commerce for having practiced it for years. 

With her new loan, she intends to purchase some bananas at 175 francs CFA per kilo and 4 sacks of peanuts at 10,000 francs each. 

In addition to bolstering her savings in order to obtain bigger loans, she plans on supporting her husband in managing their children’s schooling costs.

loans.use: to purchase bananas and peanuts

loans.name: Aisha

texts.en:
Aisha is a 19-year-old, single women and she lives with her parents. Because of money problems in her family, she can’t get an education and has to work to earn money for her family. The members of her family are refugees and have lived in an İDP settlement for a long time. Aisha raises seasonal fruits (apples, cherry, pears and etc.) and vegetables (onions, cucumbers, potatoes) and sells these products at a local bazaar. She has been working in this field for one year and has good skills. Her monthly income is 180 AZN. Her brother is a laborer and brings the family additional income.

People prefer to buy fruits and vegetables raised in private gardens. They know that such products are always fresh and tasty. They use fruits to prepare tasty fresh juice and buy vegetables to cook different delicious national dishes. Aisha ’s income doesn’t cover life’s demands. She has applied for 1,500 AZN in order to buy new garden tools, and new sorts of fruits and vegetables to sell. She wants to support her parents, so please help Aisha.

loans.use: to buy new garden tools and new sorts of fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Corazon

texts.en:
Corazon works hard to support her family. Corazon is married and has a dried fish making business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

Corazon has been in this business for seven years now.

In the future Corazon would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to make dried fish.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en: Arlyn works hard to support her family. She is married and has a general store business in the Philippines. Arlyn has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been in this business for two years now. In the future, Arlyn would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Demetria

texts.en: Demetria is 55 years old and has a live-in partner with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell in her general store. Demetria has borrowed and repaid two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from buying and selling brooms. Demetria aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Raquel

texts.en: As a married parent of three children, Raquel works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from motorcycle transport. Raquel is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy materials needed like fishing net, an ice box, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business. Raquel has been sustaining her business activities through her past 11 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy needed materials like fishing net, an ice box, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Tumaini Group

texts.fr:
Immaculée fait partie du groupe  Tumaini et  habite à  Gitega. C'est une veuve de 33 ans et a 3 enfants  âgés de 14 à 18 ans,tous étudient.


Elle fait le commerce de  bananes  ,tomates et les légumes  depuis  10ans. 


Elle est à son cinquième  crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter une grande quantité de bananes, de tomates et de légume   à revendre pour gagner plus. 


Dans les prochaines  années, elle voudrait voir ses enfants étudier.
texts.en:
Immaculée is part of the group Tumaini and lives in Gitega. She is a 33-year-old widow and has three children, from 14 to 18 years old, who are students. 

Immaculée has been doing commerce in bananas, tomatoes, and vegetables for ten years.

She is on her fifth Turame loan. With the KIVA loan she is obtaining, she is going to increase her capital and purchase a large amount of bananas, tomatoes, and vegetables to resells, so as to earn more.

In the coming years, she would like to see her children educated.

loans.use: to purchase a large amount of bananas, tomatoes, and vegetables to resells, so as to earn more

loans.name: Emelita

texts.en:
Emelita is 32 years old and married with three children. With two children currently in school, Emelita works very hard to provide for them.

Emelita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.

Emelita has been in this business for 12 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent, soap, shampoo, cereals, coffee, milk, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future Emelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Deogracia

texts.en:
As a widowed parent of six children, Deogracia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Deogracia is borrowing PHP 17,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food vending business.

Deogracia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like noodles, meat, vegetables, fish, spices, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large number of animal pelts and other livestock parts from herders and sell to manufacturers

loans.name: Nelie

texts.en:
Nelie is 56 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, etc.

Nelie has been in this business for 5 years.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, noodles, eggs, soap, etc

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
As a married mother of nine children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a rice and sugarcane farming business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 23,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies for her rice and sugarcane agriculture business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past eight loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Elba

texts.en:
Elba is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a videoke machine rental business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to buy spare parts and pay for electric bills for her videoke machine rental business.

Elba has been in this business for 3 years. Elba earns additional income from an internet cafe.

Elba has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and pay electricity bills for her videoke machine rental business

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Hace dos años, aprovechando de su novio tenía un local en el cual se dedicaba a  diseños y tatuajes, impulsada por este, Lilia, una mujer de 38 años, decidió surtirlo de mercancía variadas, aprovechando la clientela existente y como una forma de darle un a imagen mas comercial, dotándolo de ropa para la venta a crédito y de contado, como hasta hoy lo hace. Su meta es lograr el mejoramiento de la imagen cada vez más y la calidad de vida de su familia conformada por sus hijos de 10 y 18 años. Su mayor desafío es lograr fuentes de financiación que le ayuden a tener un capital adicional para trabajar. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace ala Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa, jeans, blusa etc, con esta inversión sus inventarios se incrementarán haciendo de su credikiva una inversión  exitosa.
texts.en: For two years, thanks to her boyfriend, she had a store in which she did designs and tattoos. Driven by this, Lilia, a 38-year-old woman, decided to stock the store with various goods, taking advantage of her existing clients, and, as a way of giving it a more commercial image, supplied it with clothing for sale on credit and by cash. This is what she has done so far. Her goal is to succeed in improving the image another time and in improving the quality of life for her family, which includes her children who are 10 and 18 years old. Her biggest challenge is to achieve sources of income that help her have more capital. This is the reason she turns to a Kiva loan. Her first loan is from Fundacion Mario Santo Dominago, through which she will buy clothing, jeans, shirts, etc. With this investment, her inventory will grow, making her Kiva loan a successful investment.

loans.use: to buy clothing, jeans, shirts, etc.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing 13,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.
Evelyn has been in this business for ten years. Evelyn also earns more income from selling whole roasted pigs.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts and with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Ivan De Jesus

texts.es:
El señor Iván un hombre de 65 años de edad el cual se dedicó al negocio de la agricultora toda su vida pero su pasión era otra siempre había querido tener una tienda y ser el personaje típico de la región el cual todo el barrio conoce “el famoso tendero”. 

Hace dos años cumplió gracias a la ayuda de la corporación y a los prestadores su anhelado sueño de tener una tienda en la cual vende los productos que cultiva. 

Quiere solicitar un crédito para comprar insumos que sus clientes le está pidiendo a gritos como granos y abarrotes y productos de aseo para tener un pequeño mini-mercado donde se pueda encontrar muchos de los productos que normalmente son consumidos con cotidianidad. 

Porque apoyar a Iván?, Iván es un hombre solitario que a pesar de tener 4 hijos todos ellos apoyan a la madre con la cual se separó quedando solo en su casa y su único sustento es su tienda, él trabaja 11- 13 horas diarias se mata solo pro comer y por el servicio a sus clientes es un verdadero guerrero el cual parece que los años no le pesan.
texts.en:
Señor Iván is a man of 65 who worked all his life in the agriculture business, but he had another passion. He had always wanted to have a store and be the typical character of the region whom all the neighborhood knows as "the famous shopkeeper."

Two years ago he accomplished his long-cherished dream of having a store in which he can sell the products that he raises, thanks to the help of the corporation and the lenders.

He wants to apply for a loan to buy the supplies that his customers are crying out to him for, such as grains and groceries and cleaning products, so that he can have a little mini-market where many of the products that are normally for daily consumption can be found.

Why help Iván? Iván is a lonely man in spite of having four children. They all support their mother, from whom he separated, leaving him alone in his house, and his only livelihood is his store. He works 11 - 13 hours a day. He works himself to death just to eat and to serve his customers. He is a true fighter, and it appears that his years don't weigh on him.

loans.use: to buy products for the basic family food basket requested by his customers, such as grains and groceries.

loans.name: Perfecto Moises

texts.es: Perfecto es un señor de 63 años de edad, casado con hijos ya independientes, con su actual negocio Perfecto ha logrado salir adelante para mantener los gastos de su vivienda que estos momentos él le está dando mantenimiento, es por tal motivo que él solicita un préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción para construir su servicio higiénico que preste la mejores condiciones para su familia. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de gran utilidad porque de esta forma le logra brindarles una mejores condiciones higiénicas a su familia. Sus principales metas son terminar las mejoras en su vivienda y de igual manera la construcción de su servicio higiénico.
texts.en: Perfecto is a man of 63. He is married, with children who are already independent. With his present business, Perfecto has managed to get ahead to support the expenses of his home, to which at this time he is giving maintenance. It is for this reason that he is applying for a loan to buy construction materials to construct a bathroom, which will offer better conditions to his family. He considers that the loan he has applied for will be of great use to him, because in this way he will manage to offer better sanitary conditions to his family. His principal goals are to finish the improvements in his home and, similarly, the construction of the bathroom.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to build a bathroom

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Isaack

texts.en:
Fifty-six year old Isaack does not boast of a university degree or even a certificate from an agricultural institute, but he is an accomplished farmer from Nandi Hills area of Kenya and commands a lot of respect. He is happily married and, together with his beautiful wife, they are blessed with 3 children. For the past 44 years he has been involved in mixed farming and because of the immense knowledge he has on farming, farmers from his village and neighboring villages troop to his home to seek technical advice on the best farming techniques.  His primary source of income has been milk, eggs, tea, and some personal businesses he engages in to make the extra income.  

Isaack sells cereals to his neighbors and to the local market and makes more money although his work is not without challenges he says,  though he is regarded as the best cereal seller in his village.  He has been unable to meet the market demand which has resulted in a loss of tenders.  One of his neighbors ordered 100 bags of maize which he was unable to supply. He is seeking a loan to buy more cereals so that he can satisfy the demand.  He intends to buy different variety of cereals such as millet, rice, sorghum and maize. 

Through Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that supports small scale farmers, Isaack is confident that this loan will permanently change his life. Increased profits from cereal selling will allow him to afford his highest monthly expenses- farm related comforts and the ability to channel a surplus amount to his children's education. Isaack is a visionary and plans to buy a maize milling machine through accumulated profits.

loans.use: To buy cereals

loans.name: Hilaria

texts.en:
Hilaria is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Hilaria is 50-years-old and has two children who are currently in school.

Hilaria has a tailoring business in the Philippines. Hilaria requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business.

Hilaria has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Hilaria would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more materials like fabric, threads, zippers, etc. for her business

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 50-year-old married mother of one child. Twenty five years ago, she decided to help her husband in covering the needs and expenses of their family, thus she got employed in the administration department of a school.

Because of the limited income of Daniel and her husband which satisfies only their basic needs, she is acquiring a Loan from Kiva’s field partner, Al Majmoua, to make necessary maintenance to her house and make it a healthy place to live.
 
She hopes to stay capable of supporting her husband in providing their family the best living needs and education.

loans.use: To make necessary maintenance to her house and make it a healthy place to live.

loans.name: Mwete Group

texts.fr:
Capitoline fait partie du groupe Juhudi et  habite à  Gitega. C'est une veuve de  37 ans et a  4 enfants âgés de 8 à 14 ans,tous étudient.
 
Elle fait le commerce de moutons est chèvres depuis 3 ans.

C’est son premier   crédit  à Turame. Avec le crédit KIVA qu’elle obtient, elle  va  augmenter son capital et acheter  beaucoup de moutons et chèvres à revendre pour gagner plus.
texts.en:
Capitoline is a member of the Juhudi group and lives in Gitega. She is a widow, 37 years old, and the mother of four children ranging from eight to 14 years old. All of her children attend school.

She has been selling sheep and goats for three years. This is her first loan from Turame. Thanks to the Kiva loan, she will bolster her capital and buy many sheep and goats to resell so as to increase her earnings.

loans.use: she will bolster her capital and buy many sheep and goats to resell so as to increase her earnings.

loans.name: James

texts.en:
James is a male Kiva borrower. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be focused, disciplined and straight forward. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for one year. His business is located in a busy area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be weather changes. 

He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy another motorcycle. His business goal is to own a taxi within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will live a good life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy another motorcycle

loans.name: Heibys

texts.es: Heibys de 36 años de edad es una mujer casada madre de 2 hijos en las edades de 8 y 13 años. Desde el año 1998 inició su negocio de venta de mercancias a crédito y de contado, entre sus vecinos y amigos del sector donde habita. Ella inició cuando un grupo de personas la invitaron a formar parte de una actividad comercial mediante una oferta por medio de guias especializadas de productos. Sus principales productos fueron los cosméticos, perfumería entre otros, adquiriendo una gran experiencia que la llevó a incrementar sus ingresos. Hoy vende todo tipo de mercancia. Hoy su meta es tener una infraestructura de almacen y finalmente cosntruír un segundo piso para independizar su engocio de su trabajo. Porque su gran desafio es incremntar el número de clientes y su capital de trabajo. En la actualidad está aplicando a un credikiva, primer finaciamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará cremas, ropa, shampoo, desodorante y variedades que gustan mucho a su clientela; con ello incrmentará  su stock de mercancia y cumplirá con compromisos adquiridos, para hacer de su credikiva su mejor inversión.
texts.en:
Heibys, 36, is a married woman and mother of two children, 8 and 13.  In 1998, she started her business of selling merchandise on credit and cash among her neighbors and friends in the sector where she lives.  She started it when a group of people invited her to become part of a commercial activity through an offer by guides specializing in the products.  Her first products were cosmetics and perfume among others, acquiring a great experience that brought her to increase her income.  
Today she sells all kinds of merchandise.  Today her goal is to have a warehouse infrastructure and to finally construct a second floor so she can separate her business from her work.  Because her big challenge is to increase the number of her customers and her working capital, right now she is applying for a Kiva loan, the first she has made to Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, through which she will buy creams, clothing, shampoo, deodorants, and other things that her customers like very much.  With this she will increase her stock of merchandise and fulfill her acquired commitments in order to make her Kiva loan her best investment.

loans.use: to buy creams, clothing, shampoo, deodorant, and other things that her customers like.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more plantains wholesale

loans.name: Rafuncil

texts.en:
Rafuncil is 56-years-old and a widow with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

Rafuncil has been in this business for 3 years. 

In the future, Rafuncil would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Jerramay

texts.en:
Jerramay is 32-years-old and single.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Jerramay is borrowing PHP 29,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Jerramay has been in this business for 7 years and also earns additional income from selling whole roasted pigs.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Oscar Dario

texts.es:
Oscar un hombre ingenioso que siempre busca una forma de ser productivo y apoyar a su familia, hace dos meses se encontraba sin trabajo sin dinero y con cuentas por pagar y ya por su avanzada de edad de 63 años le daba mucha dificultad encontrar trabajo. 

Con un coche de bebe que tenía lo adecuo para vender dulces y cigarrillos, como se puede observar en la foto pero para seguir operando busca desesperadamente la manera de bajar precios y la única forma que pueda hacer esto sin sufrir muchos cambios en su ganancia que en realidad es poca casi nada es comprando mercancía en grandes cantidades. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra de mercancía como dulces, envolturas, chocolates, cigarrillos en grandes cantidades pues debe surtir su carro cada dos días y con eso podrá bajar los precios que es su gran necesidad y apuro.

Este negocio es vital para él está comenzando una forma de vida sostenible y para él sería ideal concretar el crédito pide ayuda y se compromete a pagar muy puntalmente los créditos pues si lo apoyan, apoyaran su familia su hogar su futuro.
texts.en:
Oscar is an ingenious man who is always looking for a way to be productive and support his family.  Two months ago, he found himself out of work, out of money and with bills to pay and, because of his advanced age of 63, it was difficult for him to find work.
With a baby carriage he had, it was enough for him to sell sweets and cigarettes, as can be seen in the photo.  But in order to continue operating, he is desperately seeking a means to reduce prices and the only way he can do this without suffering great changes in his profits, which are really small - almost nothing, is buying merchandise in large quantities.
He is asking for a loan in order to buy merchandise such as sweets, wrappers, chocolates, and cigarettes in large quantities since he needs to stock his cart every two days and with this he will be able to reduce the prices which is his great necessity and challenge.
This business is vital for him.  He is beginning a sustainable kind of life and for him it would be ideal to nail down a loan.  He is requesting help and he promises to pay the loan punctually if you help him.  You will be supporting his family, his home and his future,

loans.use: to buy sweets, cigarettes and snacks wholesale since he desperately needs to lower his prices to continue operating.

loans.name: Jimema

texts.en:
Jimema is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Jimema is 47 years old and has one child who is currently in school.

Jimema has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional bicycle for her business.

Jimema has been in this business for eight years. Jimema would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bicycle for her business

loans.name: Merlui Verónica

texts.es: Merlui es una joven de 24 años con los más grandes deseos de superación y sabe perfectamente que solo puede salir adelante estudiando y esforzándose mucho. Merlui estudia Odontología en la universidad cercana de su comunidad y posee un pequeño negocio con el cual se ayuda a costear sus estudios es por eso que ella desea un préstamo para comprar una silla portátil y un cavitron para su negocio y de esta forma obtener más ganancias que le ayudaran con sus estudios y para su superación personal entre su comunidad. De igual manera estima que el crédito a solicitud le ayudara a que su negocio se un poco más grande y brindarles un mejor servicio a sus pacientes. Entre sus principales planes futuros está en hacer la apertura de otro nuevo negocio donde pueda hacer radiografías dentales y sus metas actuales son estudiar una especialidad.
texts.en: Merlui is a young woman of 24 with the greatest desires to achieve, and she knows perfectly that she can only get ahead by studying and exerting herself greatly. Merlui is studying odontology at a university near her community, and she has a small business with which she helps to pay for her studies. It is for this reason that she wants a loan to buy a portable chair and a Cavitron (ultrasonic scaler) for her business and in this way obtain more earnings that will help her in her studies and for her personal development in her community. In the same way, she feels that the loan she has applied for will help her business to be a little bigger and help her to offer better service to her patients. Among her principal plans for the future is opening another new business where she can do dental x-rays, and her present goals are to study a specialty.

loans.use: to buy a portable chair and a Cavitron (ultrasonic scaler)

loans.name: Mahammad

texts.en: Mahammad is 49 years old, married and the father of four kids. His sons are married and live separately. Mahammad is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with his family in Bilasuvar region.  He is a salesman working in jewelry. His salary is not enough to cover the family's needs. For this reason, Mahammad needs a loan to become a partner, expand his jewelry business and increase his store's income. This is going to be his first loan.  Mahammad hopes that Kiva will be able to help him in this business. Please support Mahammad.

loans.use: to become a partner and expand his jewelry business

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en:
Juliana is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be God fearing. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes for selling. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a competitive area, and her primary customers are reliable. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

She will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more tailoring materials. Her business goal is to be profitable within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials.

loans.name: Mwema

texts.en: Mwema is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be a risk taker. He operates a retail business where he sells bread. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an area with high potential. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of bread. His business goal is to be able to run a bakery within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread

loans.name: Ndeye Aminata's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide puisse que vivant dans le même village depuis des décennies.

Madame Ndèye (assise à droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée mère de 07 enfants dont 03 garçons et 04 filles. Elle tient une gargote au village où elle vend le petit déjeuner, elle a aussi un frigo à l’intérieur qui la permet de diversifier ses ventes par la préparation de jus naturels pour la clientèle.
 
Avec son nouveau crédit, elle compte se ravitailler pour la préparation des mets : des tablettes d’œuf, un sac d’ognon et de pomme  de terre et des ingrédients par bocal ou seau.

Les bénéfices lui permettront de participer à la prise en charge des besoins de la famille en santé, scolarité pour les enfants.
texts.en:
This group is composed of very engaged women who have managed to grow their businesses since the creation of bank villageois on June 6, 2002. They mainly make a living as vendors. They show a strong spirit of solidarity and mutual help since they have been living in the same village for decades.

Mrs. Ndèye (the one seated on the right raising her hand) is the star borrower of the group. She is married and the mother of seven: three sons and four daughters. She manages a modest diner in her village, where she sells breakfast. She also has a refrigerator inside, which allows her to diversify her sales by preparing natural juices for her customers.
With this new loan, she plans to stock up on cooking ingredients: racks of eggs, a bag of onion and potatoes as well as other ingredients by jar or pail.

loans.use: to stock up on cooking ingredients: racks of eggs, a bag of onion and potatoes as well as other ingredients by jar or pail.

loans.name: Marta Erminia

texts.es: Marta de 59 años de edad vive en casa propia junto a su nieto, su hijo vive en estados unidos y le ayuda económicamente, ella se dedica a la comercialización de flores, el negocio lo tiene ubicado en el mercado que se encuentra cerca de su lugar de residencia, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra cubrir los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, Doña marta está volviendo a solicitar un crédito para poder comprar más flores por mayor y seguir con su negocio ya que le ha estado generando buenas ganancias ya que es su única fuente de trabajo y asi podrá seguir teniendo una calidad de vida digna junto a su nieto.
texts.en: Marta, who is 59 years old, lives in her own house with her grandson. Her son lives in the United States and helps her economically. She sells flowers. She has her business located in the market that is near her place of residence. With what she obtains from her sales, she manages to cover the expenses that arise in her household. Doña Marta is turning to applying for a loan to be able to buy more flowers wholesale and continue with her business, since it has been generating good earnings for her, and since it is her only source of work, and thus she will be able to continue having a dignified quality of life along with her grandson.

loans.use: to buy flowers wholesale

loans.name: Benard

texts.en:
Benard is a married man. He has four children. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits. He has been involved in this business for two years. His business is located in a market area, and he describes his biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. 

Benard will use this 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits. His business goal is to have a stable business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a better life. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits.

loans.name: Joji

texts.en:
Joji is 46 years old and has a live-in partner with two children. Joji works very hard to provide for them. Joji runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional stock including candies, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft-drinks, etc. to sell.

Joji has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as candies, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft-drinks, etc. She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional stock including candies, biscuits, canned goods, shampoo, sanitary pads, toothpaste, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Rosie

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Rosie works hard to support her family. She has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosie is borrowing 17,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of the motorcycle used for her motorcycle transport business.

Rosie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 19 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Liezl

texts.en:
Liezl is 29 years old and married with one kid in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Liezl has a business selling spices and dried fish in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 PHP loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more stock of spices and dried fish to sell.

Liezl has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of spices and dried fish to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.es: Lourdes, tiene 39 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su pareja con quien  tiene 4 hijos, vive con su familia en una aldea del municipio de Concepción del Sur, Santa Bárbara. Ella se dedica a la cría de cerdos para la venta. Este negocio lo tiene hace 6 años en su casa. Los  cerdos los vende en la comunidad para destazo. Siempre le ha gustado al negocio, anteriormente  tenía una  pulpería. El  préstamo es un segundo ciclo y solicita  10,000 lempiras para la compra de concentrados y vitaminas para que sus cerdos estén en buen estado de salud y crecimiento. Su  plan es mejorar el local para tener una mejor cría  de cerdos.
texts.en:
Lourdes is 39 years old and lives with her life partner and their four children. They live with Lourdes' family in a village in the municipality of Concepción del Sur, Santa Barbara. 

Lourdes raises hogs for sale. She sells the pigs to the community for slaughter. She has had this business for the past six years and runs it from her home. She has always enjoyed business - before running this business she owned a small corner store.

This loan will be her second and she requests 10,000 Lempiras to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins to help the pigs grow and keep them in good health. Her plan is to improve her location to be able to raise more pigs.

loans.use: to purchase concentrated feed and vitamins for her hogs.

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is a married man. He has 4 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 10 years. He describes himself to be innovative. He operates a retail business where he sells fruits and vegetables. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a competitive area and his primary customers are reliable. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate funds. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. His business goal is to yield high returns within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes

loans.name: Francis

texts.en: Francis is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a photography business where he takes photos. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more stock of camera films and two more cameras. His business goal is to own a photo studio within five years. This is his fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of camera films and two more cameras

loans.name: Sami

texts.en:
Sami is a 28-year-old married man living with his family in his own house in the capital city of Sana'a, Yemen. He is a very active and dynamic young man and he strives to make his family more stable. In time, he was able to accumulate a good amount of money and purchased a piece of land. He built his own house on the land that he purchased. He completed building his house and it is now ready to live in.  Unfortunately, this business cost him a lot of money. Now, the house needs a lot of furniture, but Sami doesn't have enough money for that. Therefore, Sami applied for a youth loan of 350,000 YER from AMB. He will use the loan to purchase many kinds of furniture and home appliances for his new house.
 
Sami looks forward to providing his house with all the home appliances and furniture needed to make his house more comfortable and suitable for the best life. He hopes to open a commercial business that will help him to improve the living standards of his family.

loans.use: to purchase many kinds of furniture and home appliances for his new house

loans.name: Karen

texts.en:
Karen is passionate for women’s rights and social justice and brings this into her business in the coffee industry. Sit her down, and she’ll flood your brain with information about the inequities faced by women in the industry. But rather than being another “armchair activist” or “keyboard warrior”, Karen is someone who puts her words into action.

She has most recently done this by starting her company Coffee Cares’, which buys and sells coffee beans from sustainable, women-run coffee farms and provides microfinance loans to those women farmers. The company also sells a software platform to corporations that allows them to track the philanthropic activities of their employees, with added features such as allowing users to calculate tax deductions.

Trying to increase cash flow to make larger purchases, Karen will use her Kiva loan to buy more coffee to import to the United States.

Being a trailblazer is not easy. Karen started the business with no money and was the second woman CEO of a coffee company in the US. The coffee industry has historically been a male-dominated industry; however, with her strident, outspoken voice, Karen is making waves and the industry will not stay that way for long.

loans.use: to buy more coffee to import to the United States

loans.name: Felix

texts.en: Felix is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be optimistic. He operates a transport business, in which he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a vibrant location and his primary customers are of all types. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the 20,000 KES loan to buy three bicycles for his transport business. His business goal is to own a tuk tuk within 5 years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy three bicycles

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 26-year-old, single man. He is the sole earner of his family which consists of another ten members. Seven years ago, he got employed in an upholstering furniture company to cover the expenses and needs of his family.

Throughout these years, Wissam worked hard and gained a good reputation and experience in this field. He tried hard to cover the needs of his beloved family while saving some profit for his personal future. 

Today, he is preparing himself for his wedding, thus he is acquiring a YOUTH Loan from Kiva’s field partner Al Majmoua to buy an elegant bedroom and continue the wedding preparation process.

Wissam hopes to open his own upholstery furniture shop in the future that would increase his income to cover the needs and expenses of his beloved family.

loans.use: to buy an elegant bedroom and continue the wedding preparation process

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 34 years old and married with three children in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. 

Mary Jane has been in this business for four years. 

In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, and groceries

loans.name: Alejandro

texts.es: En el año 2007, don Alejandro trabajaba como empleado de una empresa y perdió sus manos como producto de un accidente laboral,  cuando realizaba trabajos eléctricos en altura. Como consecuencia de este suceso quedó sin empleo y debió emprender un negocio. Esta fue la razón por la cual inició ofreciendo el servicio de alquiler de máquinas de  lavandería en su vecindad,  a domicilio y de contado.  Poco a poco sus vecinos empezaron a referenciarlo y su clientela creció; hoy su mayor deseo es continuar ampliando su negocio especialmente la infraestructura física  y lograr pensionarse . Para el crecimiento de su negocio su capital de trabajo no es suficiente es su mayor desafío tenrlo disponible; esta es la razón por la cual ha acudido a un credikiva, mediante el cual comprará nuevas lavadoras para remplazar las antiguas, que se encuentran obsoletas. Con esta inversión su negocio mejorará pues se activará la clientela, accediendo una nueva infraestructura física mas efectiva, que impactará mucho mas su mercado.
texts.en: In the year 2007, Don Alejandro was working as an employee in a business and lost his hands as the result of a work accident when he was doing electrical work at heights. As a result of this event, he was left without employment, and he needed to begin a business. This was the reason why he began offering the service of renting washing machines in his neighborhood, in homes and for cash. Little by little, his neighbors began to refer him, and his clientele grew. Today his greatest desire is to continue expanding his business, especially the physical infrastructure, and be able to retire. His working capital is not sufficient for the growth of his business. His greatest challenge is to have it [capital] available. This is the reason why he has turned to a Kiva loan, through which he will buy new washing machines to replace the old ones, which are obsolete. With this investment, his business will improve, since his customers will be enthused, accessing a new, more effective physical infrastructure, which will impact his market much more.

loans.use: to buy new washing machines.

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en:
Julieta is 38 years old and married with four children.

Julieta works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 16,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Julieta has borrowed and paid back 6 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from selling fruits.

Julieta aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell of frozen foods business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to purchase chicken, bacon, sliced meat, fish, etc.

Violeta has been in this business for 12 years now.

In the future, Violeta would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase chicken, bacon, sliced meat, fish, etc

loans.name: George

texts.en:
Hello lenders! Meet George, 45, who is based in the Nandi hills area of Kenya. This area may be the major 'bread basket' of the country, but it is increasingly emerging as an important dairy farming zone for the East Africa. Thousands of farmers are now finding dairy farming a good supplement, if not a substitute, for maize .This father of three has been practicing mixed farming for the past 14 years and his primary source of income has been milk and eggs. He passionately loves dairy farming and he enjoys feeding “Ichuni” (the name of his cow). Milking his cow is his hobby .Waking up every morning to milk his cow is very fulfilling to him. The biggest challenge he faces is the lack of a proper dairy unit where his cows can feed and rest. Because of this, he has suffered losses through diseases that attack his cows because of the harsh weather conditions. If you are to reap more from cows, you must feed them properly to get high quality milk.

He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to build a modern dairy unit. With the loan, he will be able to increase his milk production, improve his living conditions and secure the future of his school-going children.

loans.use: To buld a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Bufalo A Group

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman and a mother of two schooling daughters. She is in her mid thirties and has been a businesswoman running a food business. She has a room where she fries Irish potatoes with meat called Mishkaki. Fatuma also makes fresh juices and ice cream to sell. She has been in this business for two years now. Working from 9 am until 10 pm daily, she is able to make a fair monthly profit.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her first loan request. She will use the loan to buy Irish potatoes, cooking oil, fruits for making juice, charcoal, and firewood for her business. She needs to buy enough stock so that it becomes easier to see her business returns. She dreams that one day she will became a successful businesswoman.

She will share this loan with her loan group "BUFALO A", which totals 13 members who will hold each other responsible for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy irish potatoes, cooking oil, fruits, charcoal and firewood for her business.

loans.name: Akil

texts.en: Akil is a special needs client from Iraq. He is 38 year old, married and has six children. He is the only provider for the family. Akil owns a small bakery. He established his business in 2005. He has gained good experience since he worked before in this field with his friends. He is well known in the surrounding area and has an excellent reputation. Akil is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to renovate the bakery. He is aiming to grow his business and expand his shop in the future so he can increase his profits and make more income for his family.

loans.use: to renovate his bakery

loans.name: Angelie

texts.en:
Angelie works hard to support her family. Angelie is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

She requested a 13,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell.

Angelie has been in this business for four years now.

In the future, Angelie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo, groceries, etc. to sell

loans.name: Diocena

texts.en: Farming has been Diocena's main source of income. With her sacrifices and hard work, she was able to increase her income and invest in another business (a variety store). Diocena has been running her variety store for one year. She is glad because her farming and variety store keep improving. At her age of 54, she still hopes for a brighter future so she would like to borrow additional capital to be able to buy more stocks of grocery items and generic drugs to sell. She is asking for a loan of PHP 7,000. She hopes to obtain this loan to increase her income and support her two grandchildren, with whom she's living.

loans.use: to purchase grocery items and generic drugs to sell

loans.name: Azhar

texts.en: Azhar is a special needs client from Iraq. She is 45 year old, single and lives with her three siblings. She is the only provider for the family. Azhar is a seamstress. She established her business in 2010 but she has been working at this for a long time. She makes clothes for women and she has become very well known in the surrounding area with a good reputation. Azhar is requesting a loan of 3,000 USD to buy two sewing machines and a big generator. She is aiming to grow her business so her profits will increase and she will be able to provide a better lifestyle for her siblings.

loans.use: to buy two sewing machines and a big generator

loans.name: Yanfary Vanessa

texts.es:
Con el sueño de tener su propio sueño de belleza y no solo eso sino tener el salón de belleza más reconocido y destacado del sector la Joven Yenfary quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de insumos y una silla adecuada parta motilar, los insumos serán muy variados van desde tratamientos para el cabello, tanto de hombre como de dama, champo, productos para el cuidado de la piel, crema de manos, productos para las uñas, tinturas y una silla adecuada para motilar que tenga también para realizar uñas y prestas los dos servicios simultanéanos. 

Yenfary es una mujer de 25 años de edad quien inicio como ayudante en un salón de belleza pero su ambición no tenía fronteras y no descanso hasta montar su propio salón el cual quiere mejorar y convertirlo en todo un estandarte de la zona. 

Yenfary con el préstamo podrá mejorar su ventas será más competente y ofrecer a la comunidad empleos, un sector pobre urgido de oportunidades para salir adelante en la vida.
texts.en:
With the dream of having her own beauty salon, and not just any beauty salon but the best-known and most outstanding beauty salon in her area, Yenfary wishes to request a loan to purchase supplies and a better chair. She will purchase a variety of supplies, from hair treatments for men and women, shampoo and hair dye; to skincare products such as hand creams and nail products. She will also purchase a new chair which lends itself better to cutting hair and doing nails simultaneously.

Yenfary is 25 years old. She began as an assistant in a beauty salon but her ambition knows no boundaries and she did not rest until she opened her own salon which she now wants to improve and convert into neighborhood institution.

With the loan, Yenfary will be able to improve her sales and be more competitive and create jobs in the community, a poor area desperate for more opportunity to help people get ahead in life.

loans.use: to purchase supplies to sell such as hair treatment and dyes and hand cream.

loans.name: Parvin

texts.en:
Parvin is a 24-year-old young married woman and has a one-year-old daughter. She never went to school because of her parents' financial situation and the war. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in the Bilasuvar region. They are living in hard conditions and because of that she works every day without rest. Parvin grows fruits and vegetables. She learned this from her father. This has allowed her to move her family ahead. Parvin's day starts at 6:00 am because she wakes up very early to milk the cows. 

She is requesting a loan from Aqroinvest CU to buy seed and manure. Her dream in the future is to see her child graduate with a college degree because she was not able to do it. Please support Parvin.

loans.use: to buy seed and manure.

loans.name: Nazila

texts.en: Nazila is 57 years old, married and the mother of three kids. She is an IDP (internally displaced person) and lives with her family in Bilasuvar region. Nazila is a teacher but her salary is not enough to cover her family's needs. Because of that, she has also worked in agriculture, specifically growing crops and animal husbandry. Nazila is the only breadwinner in family. She is a very kind and responsible woman, very social and hardworking. She has four milking cows with calves and her fresh milk and dairy products are in great demand among local residents to whom she sells them. Nazila's husband helps her in this business. Her customer base increases every day. Therefore, Nazila has decided to develop her business. She has turned to Aqroinvest CU for a loan of 1,500 AZN to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows. She plans to build a big barn with the profits from the loan and to start building a house for her son.

loans.use: to buy mineral fertilizers and two milking cows

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy fabric and materials and repair his sewing machine.

loans.name: Hefseba Group

texts.en:
Warda, who is in her mid 30s, is married with four children who are still at school. She has been running several projects: selling charcoal, making and selling mandazi and selling cooking oil door to door.  She has been in her businesses for four years now.  She works from 4 am to 8 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.

This will be Warda's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to buy sugar, baking flour for making mandazi, charcoal and cooking oil, which she sells to customers who sell chips.  She has paid back her loan successfully.  She used the profit to pay for school fees, opened an account in NMB bank and covered household expenses.  She will use this loan to buy sacks of charcoal, to make and sell mandazi and to sell cooking oil door to door.  She dreams of buying and selling Irish potatoes in dZanziba. 

Warda will share this loan with her loan group "Hefseba", which has three members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, cooking oil and ingredients to make mandazi

loans.name: Carmencita

texts.en:
Carmencita is 42-years-old and married with two school-aged children. Carmencita works very hard to provide for them. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

Carmencita has been in this business for six years. 

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like shampoo and groceries.

loans.name: Rodrigo

texts.en: Rodrigo is a responsible father who is raising his family in a rural community. He is 57 years old and has four children. He is engaged in the hog-raising business to have additional income. He aims to improve the living status of his family and give them a better living. He planned to improve his farming and hog-raising businesses but he does not have enough capital. For this reason, he would like to avail a loan of PHP 20,000 to buy hog feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs. Through this loan, he is hoping that he will further improve the business and make it more profitable.

loans.use: to buy feed, vitamins and vaccines for his hogs

location.town: Brgy. Sta. Clara, Aritao, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Abduvaly

texts.ru: Абдували добрый и целеустремленный человек. Он родился в 1996 году. Абдували после окончания средней школы поступил в университет. Данное время он является студентом 1 курса Таджикского Государственного Университета Коммерции. Он учится в факультете Мировая экономика. Абдували живет с родителями на северной части Таджикистана. Его отец трудовой мигрант в Российской Федерации, а мать работает заместителем директора в средней школе. Абдували хочет получить высшее образование и работать в какой-либо организации. Он запрашивает займ на сумму 1450 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту и надеется на ваше милосердие.
texts.en: Abduvaly is a kind and focused young man who was born in 1996.  Having graduated from secondary school, he got into the Tajik State University of Commerce and is now enrolled as a first-year student in the department of World Economy.  He lives with his parents in northern Tajikistan.  His father is currently in Russia, working as a migrant laborer.  His mother is the assistant principal at the local high school.  Abduvaly wants to get a higher education and work in some organization.  He is taking a loan of 1,450 USD to pay his university tuition fees.  He is relying on your kindness and compassion.

loans.use: to pay his university tuition fees.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is 40 years old and has two children. Vilma is married, and both of her children are in school.

Vilma is in the agricultural business, farming rice in the Philippines. Vilma requested a 22,000 PHP (Philippines pesos) loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vilma has been farming rice for 10 years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jeanne D Arc

texts.en: Jeanne D Arc is 27 years old. She is married with two children aged 6 and 2 years; one of them goes to school. She sells foodstuffs and has been working for six years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum, beans and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees and renovate her house.

loans.use: To buy more sorghum, beans and cassava for sale.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en: Marites is 40 years old and blessed with five children. They live in a rural community and make their living through farming. Despite being a widow, she has the determination to improve the living status of her family. She aims to expand her rice plantation but she has inadequate capital. For this reason, she would like to avail a loan of PHP 17,000 to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting the rice seedlings. Being a kind and industrious mother, she believes that she will improve her farming business and have a plentiful harvest.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and herbicides and pay the expenses incurred in transplanting rice seedlings

loans.name: Chelsea Group

texts.en:
Mwanaeli is married and the mother of four schooling children. She is in her forties and for three years now, she has had two businesses. One is mamalishe and the other a charcoal store. She starts working from 6 am to 6 pm per working day and is able to make a good profit each month.

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request which she will use to replenish more sacks of charcoal for her charcoal store. She used the previous loans, since repaid, to buy cooking pots and chairs for her mamalishe. Mwanaeli managed to receive extra income which she used to cover school fees, household expenses and saved part of it. In the coming years, she would like to build a house and provide a better education for her children.

Mwanaeli will share this loan with her loan group "Chelsea" which totals four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to replenish more sacks of charcoal for her charcoal store

loans.name: Vebce

texts.en:
Vebce is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agriculture business farming rice and raising pigs in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 19,500 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vebce successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business. 

NWTF is listing Vebce's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide puisse que vivant dans le même village depuis des décennies.

Madame Fatou (assise à droite avec une main levée dans la photo), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 07 enfants dont 04 garçons et 03 filles. Elle est  très engagée et  fait le commerce de poisson séché et huile de palme qu’elle achète pratiquement tous les 15 jours au marché hebdomadaire de la commune pour la revente au détail dans son village et aux environs.

 Son nouveau prêt lui permettra d’acheter : deux paniers de poisson séché et 03 bidons d’huile de palme pour la revente.

Elle compte avec les bénéfices améliorer les conditions de vie de sa famille, soutenir son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
This group is made up of women who are all very involved, and have managed to develop their retail businesses since the creation of the 'Banc Villageois' on 6th June 2002.
