There is a strong tradition of self-help and mutual support within the group, which results from the members living in the same village for many years.

Fatou (sitting on the right, with her hand raised in the photo) is the group representative.  She is married and has seven children, four boys and three girls.  She is very active and sells dried fish and palm oil.  She buys her supplies every two weeks at the local weekly market.  She then retails her products in her village and the surrounding area.  This loan will be used to buy 2 baskets of dried fish and 3 drums of palm oil for resale.  

Fatou plans to use her profits to improve the living conditions of her family, and help her husband to provide for the day-to-day expenses of their household.

loans.use: to buy 2 baskets of dried fish and 3 drums of palm oil for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a large amount of clothing inventory from Erlian, China

loans.name: Qorxmaz

texts.en:
Qorxmaz is 43-year-old, married father of two kids. He is raising seasonal fruits and vegetables such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But, he has a problem with water because he consistently has to borrow water from his neighbor in order to water his land. 

For this reason, he needs your financial support. He is requesting a loan of 1,200 AZN. With this money, he plans to buy tools to build a sluiceway. He is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for the loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
Leah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has an agriculture business farming rice in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Leah successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

NWTF is listing Leah's business profile in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Alvanie

texts.en: Alvanie is 40 years old. She is married with five children aged between 11 years and 5 months. Four of them go to school. She sells potatoes and has been working for the past one year. With the loan, she would like to buy more potatoes to sell. Profits from the business will be used on land for rearing her cattle.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Ilaha

texts.en:
Ilaha is 50 years old, married and the mother of two kids. She grows seasonal fruits and vegetables, such as corn, cucumbers, tomatoes, apples, pears, peaches, plums, and cherries. But, she has a problem with water because she consistently has to borrow water from her neighbor in order to water her land.

For this reason, she needs your financial support. She is requesting a loan in the amount of 1,500 AZN. With this money, she plans to buy tools to build a sluiceway. She is thankful to Kiva and the Aqroinvest organization for a loan.

loans.use: to buy tools to build a sluiceway

loans.name: Saye

texts.fr:
Cette femme, fait parti du banc villageois qui a été créé le  16 avril 2010. Ce banc regroupe des membres qui vivent dans le même village  et ceux des alentours. Les femmes entretiennent de bonnes relations et font du commerce et de l’embouche comme activité.
Elle est âgée de 25, mariée et mère de 4 enfants.
Elle envisage de faire de l’embouche ovine. Avec le prêt, elle va acheter 4 moutons à raison de 70000f chaque mouton. Elle assure les frais vétérinaires, achète de l’aliment de bétail 4 sac à 28000f.
Une fois  bien engraisser, elle vendre un mouton à 150000f.
Avec les bénéfices, elle renforce la nourriture de la famille, elle soutien  son mari et  elle certains matériels dont elle aura besoin dans la maison.
texts.en:
Saye is a member of the 'Banc Villageois' which was created on 16th April 2010.  The Banc Villageois is made up of members who live in the same village or the surrounding area,  they are all very friendly and work raising livestock.

Saye is 25 years old, married and mother to four children.  She raises sheep for a living.  Her loan will be used to buy 4 sheep for 70,000 francs CFA each.  She will also pay veterinary fees and buy 4 sacks of animal feed for 28,000 francs CFA.  Once the sheep have been fattened up, she will sell them for 150,000 francs CFA.  Saye will use her profits to improve the food that she provides for her family, help support her husband and buy certain things that she needs for her household.

loans.use: to buy 4 sheep for fattening up and resale.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en:
Cecilia is 38 years old and married with six children, four of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Cecilia has a clothing sales business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 21,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear to sell.

Cecilia has been in this business for 19 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items like blouses, pants and other ready-to-wear to sell.

loans.name: Joys

texts.en: Joys is aged 46. She is married with three children between 28 and 22 years old, all of whom are married. She sells clothes and has been running the business for the past 19 years. With the loan, she would like to buy more skirts, shirts and trousers to sell. The profits from the business will be used to reinvest in the same business and for the welfare of her family.

loans.use: to buy more skirts, shirts and trousers to sell.

loans.name: Josie

texts.en: To generate income, Josie has been engaged in buying and reselling fruits and vegetables within the public market. She is 35 years old and has five schooling children. Due to the high cost of school fees and commodities, she aims to further improve her business to earn a higher profit. Having inadequate capital, she would like to avail herself of a loan of PHP 10,000 to buy more stock of cabbages, tomatoes, celery, carrots, beans, onions and more leafy vegetables to resell. She is hoping that she will further improve the business through this financial assistance.

loans.use: to buy more stock of  cabbages, tomatoes, celery, carrots, beans, onions and more leafy vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Fanny

texts.en:
As the married mother of seven children, Fanny works hard to support her family.

She has a rice retailing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from businesses raising livestock and selling salt. Fanny is borrowing PHP 50,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell to customers.

Fanny has been sustaining her business activities through her past 25 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.en: Jacqueline is 30 years old. She is married with four children aged between 10 and 1 year old, three of whom go to school. She sells sorghum and has been working for the past five years. With the loan, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to pay school fees for her children and for their welfare.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Adzo

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé,  Adzo  est  âgée de 29 ans. Elle est mariée  et  mère  de2 enfants. Adzo vend  les friperies  et  s’approvisionne  2 fois  par  mois  au  marché  de Hédzranawé et  revend  par  vente ambulante.  Adzo  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus bénéfice.
texts.en:
Adzo is 29 years old and lives in the Adidogomé district of Lomé.  She is married and has two children.  Adzo sells second-hand clothing.  She buys her stock twice a month at the Hédzranawé market, and resells it on foot.

Adzo has requested her loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 75 units of second-hand clothing for resale.

loans.name: Kokoe

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier de adidogomé, Kokoe  est âgée de 43ans,  elle est mariée  et  mère  d’un  enfant.  Kokoe vend  les chaussures et  s’approvisionne une  fois par  mois  au marché Hédzranawé.  Elle  les revend au marché de Katsi.  Kokoé  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de bénéfices.
texts.en:
Kokoe is 43 years old and lives in the Adidogomé district of Lomé.  She is married and has one child.  Kokoe sells shoes, which she buys once a month from the Hédzranawé market.  She then sells them at the Katsi market.

Kokoe has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 90 pairs of shoes for resale.

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 50ans  résidente  à  Lomé dans le quartier  d’Adidogomé ,  Ama  est  mariée et mère de 4 enfants. Elle  vend  des condiments et des petits poissons. Elle s’approvisionne au  marché  d’assiyéyé et  au grand marché  2 fois par mois et  les revend  à son domicile. Ama sollicite un prêt  pour  faire prospérer  son activité afin de réaliser  plus de bénéfice.
texts.en:
Ama is 50 years old and lives in the Adidogomé district of Lomé.  She is married and has four children.  Ama sells food ingredients and small fish.  She buys her stock at the Assiyéyé market and at the main market, twice a month.  She then sells the food from her home.

Ama has requested this loan in order to support and improve her business so that it generates bigger profits.

loans.use: to buy 2 sacks of chillies, tomatoes and 3 baskets of smoked fish for resale.

loans.name: Dafonké

texts.fr: Agée de 60 ans,  demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, elle est  mariée  et  mère  d’un enfant. Dafonké  vend des friperies de draps de lit et des culotte  et  s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois  au  marché  de Hédzranawé et  revend  par  vente ambulante dans les environs de son quartier.  Dafonké sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et réaliser plus  de profit.
texts.en:
Dafonké is 60 years old and lives in the Adidogomé district of Lomé.  She is married and has one child.  Dafonké sells second-hand bed sheets and underwear.  She buys her stock twice a month from the Hédzranawé market, and then sells it on foot in her local neighbourhood.

Dafonké has requested this loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 25 bed sheets and underwear for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more stock of jewelry and other items in bulk.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is a 56-year-old man, married to Jostina, who adds additional income to support their family welfare. They are blessed with five children. William has been operating a motorcycle transportation business for a period of seven years, earning himself an income of KES 4,000 at the end of every month.
 
William was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 5,000. He intends to use the entire amount to repair one of his motorcycles that has mechanical challenges.

William plans to use the anticipated income to start a soft drink shop as a secondary business and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success so he can provide the best quality education to his children.

loans.use: to repair one of his motorcycles that has some mechanical challenges.

loans.name: Vesna

texts.en:
Vesna is a mother of a 27-year-old daughter who is currently a student. She is working as a cleaner in a faculty and her husband works in the municipality as an administrator. Together, they are all living in one of the minority communities.

Vesna has managed to build an annex onto her house, which was very necessary to meet her family needs, but still needs to build the toilette. She intends to use the loan in order to complete their annex and be able to enjoy the space. She is very grateful for this opportunity and promises to pay on time. Vesna feels very happy to have this opportunity to be able to create a better environment.

loans.use: to purchase wood in advance, preparing for the winter.

loans.name: Majd

texts.en: Majd is a 22-year-old university student majoring in historical places maintenance and management, and she is in her fourth year. Her father is the only provider for her family. Majd is seeking to finish her study so that she will start working in her field to support her family financially. She doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Snezana

texts.en:
Snezana is 27 years old and the mother of three children. She works in a clinic doing administrative work while her husband works in a municipality. She has saved for her entire life to build a new house because the one they have is very old and in poor condition. 

She doesn’t have enough money to complete two rooms and is requesting a loan in order to purchase material and pay for the labor. She is very happy that she finally has a chance to achieve her goal of having a very beautiful house. She wants to thank all of the lenders for making her dream come true.

loans.use: to purchase material to complete two rooms.

loans.name: Maria Gladiz

texts.es:
María es una mujer muy luchadora, trabajadora, responsable y emprendedora que tiene una tienda general ubicada en la vereda de San Juan, una zona de muy difícil acceso que le dificulta traer productos de la capital, una zona donde las tiendas escasean. 

Es madre de 6 hijos que tienen un rango de edad entre los 14-35 años de edad, los ha mantenido, brindado estudio, alimentación, vivienda y amor gracias a su tienda. 

Es una mujer de 52 años de edad con mucha experiencia y sabe que pro ser una de las pocas tiendas del sector debe brindar productos y tener inventario disponible para sus vecinos, quienes la necesitan más que ella a ellos y María lo sabe y es consciente de ello. 

Solicita un crédito para la compra  de surtido, de aseo personal, jabones, papel higiénico, lavaplatos, productos limpiadores, salsas, aceite, mantequilla, etc. productos que por lo general no se producen en las fincas y son de muy regular consumo.
texts.en:
María is a feisty, hard-working, responsible and enterprising woman who has a general store in the village of San Juan. San Juan is very difficult to access and has few shops so María must bring stock from the capital city. Her

María is a mother to six children, ranging from 14 to 35 years old. She has supported her children, given them an education and a home, fed them, and loved them, all thanks to her shop.

María is 52 years old and has a lot of experience. She knows that, given that she has one of the few shops in the area, she must provide products and have stock available for her neighbours, who need it more than she does.

María is applying for a loan in order to buy stock - personal hygiene products, soap, lavatory paper, washing up liquid, cleaning products, sauces, oil and more. These are products that are commonly consumed and that cannot be produced on farms.

loans.use: to buy merchandise that is not generally produced on farms, such as lavatory paper, soap, washing-up liquid, oil, bleach, sanitary towels and more.

loans.name: Reina Esperanza

texts.es: Reyna de 57 años de edad vive junto a su esposo y sus hijos, ella es una persona muy trabajadora y responsable con su familia, se dedica a la agricultura siembra maíz y frijol, tiene mucha experiencia en la actividad por eso cultiva muy buenos productos, con las ganancias que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, Reyna está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. así como muestra en la fotografía para continuar con sus siembras, obtener mejores ganancias y darle a su familia una mejor estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Reyna is 57 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is very hard-working and responsible with her family. Reyna makes a living in farming - she grows corn and beans. She has a lot of experience in this work and so harvests very good products. With profits from her sales, she is able to cover some household costs. Reyna is applying for a loan in order to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease chemicals and more (as shown in the photograph). With these items she can earn higher profits and give her family more financial stability.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilisers, manure, anti-disease chemicals and more.

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.es:
Nicolas, con 53 años de edad, es padre de 1 hijo al cual siempre ha procurado por ofrecerle lo mejor. 

Se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable y trabajador, un visionario y buen negociante. Siempre ha trabajado como comerciante, vendiendo licores y algunos comestibles en su bar, desde hace 13 años tiene su propio negocio.  

Ha sabido superar tiempos difíciles en el comercio y sueña con comprarse su casa propia y tener un negocio que perdure en el tiempo; es por ello que Nicolas acudió a solicitar un préstamo, el cual utilizará para comprar surtido de licores, frituras y demás comestibles para abastecer su negocio y poder seguir sacando su negocio adelante. 

Nicolas es un hombre muy organizado y le gusta ofrecer a sus clientes una gran variedad de productos de calidad, y se siente a gusto cuando visitan su bar que tiene un ambiente bello y muy agradable.  

La suma de todo estos esfuerzos le podrían brindar una mejor calidad de vida y un mejor sustento para su hijo.
texts.en:
Nicolas is 53 years' old and is the father to one boy who he has always tried to give the best to.

He can be described as being a very responsible and hard-working man, a visionary and a good businessman. He has always worked as a shopkeeper, selling liquor and some food in his bar. He has had his own business for 13 years. 

He has been able to get through difficult times in his business and he dreams of buying his own house and having a business which is successful in the long run; which is why Nicolas has come to request a loan. He will use the loan to buy a variety of liquor, fried snacks and other food to supply his business so he can keep it going.   

Nicolas is a very organized man and he likes to offer his customers a wide variety of quality products and he enjoys the lovely, friendly atmosphere when they visit his bar.

The sum of all these efforts could offer Nicolas a better quality of life and a better livelihood for his son.

loans.use: to buy liquor and food to supply his business so he can increase his inventory and improve his boy's quality of life.

loans.name: Margarita Maria

texts.es:
Ella es Margarita, una mujer de carácter y buena voluntad, con deseos de progresar y salir adelante y mejorar su vida.

Ella se decidió por iniciar su negocio de preparación y venta de productos alimenticios como mermeladas, dulces, mantequillas, entre otros, desde hace aproximadamente 3 años en un pequeño puesto con muchas ganas y empuje.

Este oficio lo aprendió trabajando en algunos restaurantes en años pasados y esto le permitió obtener gran experiencia.

Hoy en día desea darle un pequeño impulso a su negocio, por esta razón requiere un préstamo para comprar una despulpadora e insumos como frutas, azúcar y otros ingredientes para sus preparaciones.

Este préstamo le permitirá capitalizar su negocio y mejorar su calidad de vida ya que desde que se quedo viuda ha tenido que soportar unas duras pruebas en su vida.

Es una mujer que sume retos y los enfrenta con valentía.
texts.en:
This is Margarita - a woman of great character and a kind heart. She wants to move forward and improve her life.

Margarita decided to start her own business making and selling consumable goods, such as jams, sweets, butter and more. She has been doing this from a small stall for years. She is enthusiastic about her work.

Margarita learned this trade from previously working in restaurants. It allowed her to gain a lot of experience.

Margarita wants to give her business a little drive forward and so needs a loan in order to buy a de-pulper and supplies - such as fruit, sugar and other ingredients - for making her foodstuffs.

This loan will allow Margarita to make a profit at her business and to improve her quality of life. Since being left a widow, Margarita has had to face some testing trials in life.

Margartia is a woman who takes on challenges and bravely takes them on.

loans.use: to buy a de-pulper and supplies - such as fruits - in order to continue with her business and to move forward with it successfully.

loans.name: Grupo Chicoj Group

texts.es:
De 40 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad, (Juana es la que se encuentra de 1ra de izquierda a derecha de la fotografía)
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra y venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 10 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de refacciones negocio que realiza con una hermana por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

Ella ha sido un ejemplo en su comunidad y es por ello que un grupo de mujeres se han unido a Juana para poder emprender sus negocios para que cada uno de ellas pueda supera y tener ingresos importantes.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
Juana is 40 years old. She has great dreams of making her community well known and wants people to visit it. Juana puts in a lot of effort and dedication at her work. She is married and lives with her husband. She wants to do better in life and achieve great dreams. Juana has four children: the eldest two have their own families now, while the youngest are excellent pupils at the community school. (In the photo, Juana is the first person on the left).

The work that Juana does with great care is buying and selling typical clothes. She has been doing this work in her house and in the areas near her community for ten years. Juana also sells snacks and light refreshments. She has been running this other business with one of her sisters for over five years. It generates another income for the sisters to look after their family and to improve their family's and their community's financial situation.

Juana has been a role model in her community and so a group of women have joined up with her in order to start their own businesses. With them, each woman can do better in life and earn a good income.

This loan will be used to buy typical clothes to sell in the areas surrounding her community. One of Juana's aspirations is to have her own stall at the community market, while she would also like to see her children learn a profession.

loans.use: to buy typical clothes for her business.

loans.name: Margarita De Los Milagros

texts.es:
Margarita es conviviente, reside en el distrito de Morropón, desde hace más de 15 años, la vida en la comunidad es tranquila ya que se dedican a la agricultura y ganaderia, dicha comunidad esta ubicada en la región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad a la que se dedica Margarita es a la venta de ropa desde hace más de 3 años de experiencia. Ella realiza sus ventas en su domicilio y también sale a recorrer por las avenidas y calles de la localidad. Margarita necesita del crédito para invertir en el negocio, comprando una mayor cantidad y variedad de mercaderia, para asi poder atender los diferentes gustos de sus clientes; y de esta forma hacerse más conocida, captar a un número mayor de clienes, para que sus ventas aumenten, sus ingresos crezcan y por ende sus ganancias mejoren al igual que su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Margarita has a partner and has lived in the district of Morropon for the last 15 years, located in the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru. Life in her community is peaceful; most people make a living in agriculture and livestock. 

Margarita makes a living selling clothes, and has more than 3 years experience in doing so. She performs most of her sales in her home, but also goes out to sell on the avenues and streets of her city. She needs a loan in order to invest in her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of merchandise. This will help her to be able to attend to the different tastes of her customers. In turn, she will become more well known and attract a greater number of customers in order to grow her sales and increase her income. She wants to improve her profits, which will improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in her business by buying a greater quantity and variety of merchandise.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wood, galvanized sheets, and nails and pay for labor expenses in order to replace the roof of her kitchen at home.

loans.name: Carla  Beatriz

texts.es: Carla de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, su compañero de vida que reside en los Estados Unidos pero le ayuda económicamente, ella posee una sala de belleza su negocio lo tiene ubicado en su lugar de residencia, con lo que gana de su trabajo y con la ayuda de su compañero de vida logra solventar las necesidades de su hogar, Carla solicita un crédito para la compra de productos nuevos para su sala de belleza como shampoo, tintes para el cabello, tijeras especiales, acondicionadores, etc. y así poder continuar con su trabajo para poder darle a sus hijos una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Carla is 41 years old and lives in her own home with her two children. Her life partner currently lives in the United States, but he supports her economically. She has a beauty salon business that is located in her home. With what she earns from her work, and with the help of her life partner, she is able to cover the necessities of her household. 

Carla is asking for a loan in order to buy new products for her beauty salon, such as shampoo, hair dye, special scissors, conditioners, etc. which will allow her to continue her work in order to give her children a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy shampoo, hair dye, special scissors, conditioner, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase used clothing to sell in the market.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, brick, and wood laminates to build a grease trap and make improvements to her home.

loans.name: Mikica

texts.en:
Mikica is a minority woman who has no children and lives with her husband and her father-in-law. Her husband's work as a bus driver is the main source of income. As with all residents of the minority communities, they live in very poor conditions because of the destroyed economy and lack of growth since the war. 

Mikica has not been able to repair the roof and façade of their house on her husband's income, and is requesting a loan to complete the work before the rainy and snowy season. She is very enthusiastic that through this loan she will be able to save money on her utilities and enjoy better living conditions. She promises to pay on time, and wants to thank the lenders for their support.

loans.use: To repair the roof and façade of her house before the rainy and snowy season

loans.name: Ankica

texts.en:
Ankica is a married mother who comes from a minority community. In order to earn a living, she is involved in agriculture with her husband, planting corn and wheat to sell for a profit. They also work on the neighbor’s land for a fee. 

From working for so long, their machine and tools have become very worn and damaged, so they are not effective anymore. For the first time, she is requesting a loan in order to purchase new tools for their machine and tractor. She knows that this loan will allow her to continue her business and work more effectively and efficiently, generating a higher income. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To purchase new tools for her machine and tractor

loans.name: Gjyze

texts.en:
Gjyze is a Roma woman and the mother of five children. Her husband works for an electrical company, plants wheat and corn on their land, and raises cows to sell milk and dairy products. They live in a very old house that is in poor condition despite the fact that they both work very hard to make a living. 

She has never had the opportunity to improve their living conditions because of the lack of money. At this time, she is in need of a loan to renovate the house and improve their standard of living. She is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders for their support. She promises to pay on time.

loans.use: To renovate her house and improve her standard of living

loans.name: Dobrila

texts.en: Dobrila is married and the mother of one son. She works as a teacher, her husband receives a pension, and her son is employed in a municipality doing administrative work. The three of them live together under poor conditions in one of the minority communities. Dobrila is requesting a loan to build an annex onto their home to improve their living conditions, giving them more space and privacy and improving their quality of life. Until now, she has not had the opportunity to make this addition and is very happy for this change. She wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To build an annex onto her home to improve living conditions, giving more space and privacy and improving quality of life.

loans.name: Fahri

texts.en: Fahri comes from one of the Roma minority communities. She is a mother of one son and is very poor, receiving social help, while her husband works for an electrical company. They have a very old and worn house that needs some renovations to fix all of the drafts of cold air from outside entering the house. For the first time, she is requesting a loan so that she can improve their living conditions before the colder weather sets in. She has never had the opportunity to work on her home because of the lack of money. She says that, without the loan and the help of lenders, she would never be able to manage to do this. She is very happy that she has found such a wonderful opportunity to help her to reach her goal of providing good living conditions for her family. She is very grateful to all of the lenders!

loans.use: to fix all of the drafts of cold air from outside entering her house

loans.name: Fetije

texts.en: Fetije wants to thank all the lenders for her previous loan which has helped her to level the rooms and isolations. The loan has helped her to improve her and her family's living conditions. She was very satisfied and she is borrowing for the house again in order to purchase new furniture and wood for heating for the winter season. She hopes that her husband will start his own business in the near future and she will be able to assist him in that. Her goal is to improve the living conditions of the family and she wants to thank all the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to purchase new furniture and wood for heating during the winter season.

loans.name: Mirlande

texts.en: Mirlande lives with her husband and her two children in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Their blue house has no reliable access to electricity and thus Mirlande is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. With two of her kids still at school, she wishes they had better light for studying at night. A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Mirlande and her family the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. Mirlande is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which she will repay through her payments for electricity. This loan helps Mirlande get connected to her local prepay microgrid. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here .

loans.use: to cover the upfront cost of connecting her home to Haiti’s first solar hybrid smart electricity grid

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to connect to Haiti's first solar hybrid smart electricity grid.

loans.name: Anonymous

loans.name: Indri

texts.en: This loan helps Indri get connected to his local prepay micro-grid. Indri is a 76-year-old single father of three, with one going to school. He is a farmer and lives in a small white wooden house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to be able to connect to the local solar-powered micro-grid, and to finally get rid of his dirty, costly kerosene lamp. Mainly, he is looking forward to being connected as it will allow him to save money - Indri and his family will now be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, and clean power source. After running pilots since 2012 that proved the benefits of prepay quality electricity to people in Les Anglais (first with 14 households, and up to 54), EarthSpark International is developing a full-scale, solar-powered micro-grid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers, and will be repaid over time by electricity sales. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.

loans.name: Jude

texts.en:
This loan helps Jude get connected to his local pre-pay microgrid.

Jude is a 50-year-old father of two, one who goes to school. He is a primary school teacher and lives in a small house in Les Anglais, in southern Haiti. He is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to connect to the local solar-powered microgrid and to finally get rid of his dirty, costly kerosene lamp. 

Mainly, Jude is looking forward to the improved quality of life that the electricity grid will provide for him and his family. With this loan, he and his family will be able to benefit from a reliable, durable, clean power source.

EarthSpark Internation has run pilots since 2012, first with 14 households, then up to 54. After running these pilots, which proved the benefits of pre-pay quality electricity to the people in Les Anglais, EarthSpark is developing a full-scale, solar-powered microgrid. This micro-grid is expected to meet the needs of up to 500 households. 

Kiva loans allow EarthSpark to increase the number of beneficiaries by reducing the up-front costs for customers and will be repaid over time through electricity sales.

To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please see https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=iq2m3rRDePk.

loans.name: Andala

texts.en: This loan helps Andala get connected to her local prepay microgrid. Andala runs a small business, and lives in the town of Les Anglais in southern Haiti. Her pink and green house has no reliable access to electricity, and thus Andala is forced to use costly and harmful kerosene for lighting. A solar-powered microgrid is being installed in Les Anglais, giving Andala the opportunity to connect to a higher quality, lower-cost energy source. She is looking forward to being connected, as it will allow her to save money. She is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to cover the upfront cost of connection to the grid, which she will repay through her payments for electricity. An electrical connection dramatically reduces the cost of lighting in towns such as Les Anglais, while offering far superior light quality and more generally providing opportunities for people to dramatically improve their quality of life. To see a video of Les Anglais and the hybrid solar grid, please click here.
