loans.name: Jasmina

texts.en: Jasmina is 28 years old and comes from one of the minority communities in Kosovo. She has two boys, ages 4 and 8 years old and they live in a small apartment. She is a housewife, staying home to care for the children and house while her husband is master level electrician. He is very talented and is the main source of income, fixing freezers, stoves and other appliances. Unfortunately, he does not have a shop because he has not been able to save enough money to get one. Their first priority after taking care of the daily needs of the family would be at the home. Their apartment is in need of some repairs/renovation and is requesting a loan to address them. In the future, Jasmine hopes that her husband will be able to have his own shop and make even more income. Her goal is to give her children a better future and life.

loans.use: To renovate apartment to improve their living conditions.

loans.name: Suzana

texts.en:
Suzana is 34 years old with 2 teenage children ages 13 and 16. She works in a clinic as a cleaner while her husband works for an electrical company. Together, they also are involved in agricultural work, planting corn and wheat. Suzana and her husband have been involved in this business for many years and are in need of a new tractor that has been worn down by the years of use. 

For the first time, she is requesting a loan with the hopes that she will be able to improve the living conditions of her family by harvesting more products and selling them for a greater profit. Her goal is to give her children a better education and living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new tractor.

loans.name: Florim

texts.en:
Florim is 25 years old and married, living in the Ashkali community. He is a hardworking man who helps his family to improve their life. He has been earning a living by raising and selling chickens from his home for the last 5 years. Florim has a lot of customers in his area and is satisfied with his business and income and hopes to continue to grow in the future. 

Currently, he is in need of a loan in order to renovate his chicken roost and to purchase more chickens to raise and sell. He considers this a very helpful loan as it will directly and dramatically improve his business. He hopes to increase his flock and continue with the same business.

loans.use: to renovate his chicken roost and to purchase more chickens to raise and sell.

loans.name: Cielo Maria

texts.es:
5 créditos hace valer el compromiso, puntualidad en pagos y seriedad que pone la señora cielo en sus labores pues gracias a estos créditos logro montar una papelería hace 14 años la cual fue perfeccionando con la ayuda de cada uno de ellos. 

Cielo es la típica mujer independiente que cansada de su hogar y la cotidianidad de ser ama de casa se revelo y monto el negocio esperando a triunfar para sentirse y ser productiva.

Con el pasar del tiempo vio que en el sector hacía falta una ferretería y decidió ir comprando insumos u combinar sus ventas hoy por hoy quiere solicitar un crédito para la compra de productos todos ellos de ferretería. 

Con el crédito podrá comprar una máquina para sacar duplicado de llaves, lijas, martillos, clavos, destornilladores, cemento, tuercas, entre otros. 

Cielo es madre de 3 hijos y cuida a sus nietos verdaderamente los ama y a sus 57 años de edad trabaja para poder ayudarlos brindándoles educación, comida techo, verdaderamente cielo es toda una guerrera de la vida.
texts.en:
Five loans have confirmed the commitment, punctuality and seriousness that Cielo puts into her work. Thanks to these loans, she was able to open a paper store 14 years ago and she perfected it with each one.

Cielo is a typical independent woman who was tired of being at home and the daily routine of being a housewife. She started the business hoping to triumph and feel productive. 

As time passed, she saw that the area needed a hardware store and she decided to buy materials and combine her sales. Today she wants to ask for a loan to buy products, all of them for a hardware store. 

With the loan, she will be able to buy a key making machine, sandpaper, hammers, nails, screwdrivers, cement, nuts, and more.  

Cielo is the mother of 3 children and she cares for her grandchildren. She truly loves them and at 57 years old she works to be able to offer them education, food, and shelter. Truly, Cielo is a life warrior.

loans.use: to buy hardware items, a key making machine, hammers, nuts, and screwdrivers. These will be for opening the first mini-hardware store in the area.

loans.name: Ehab

texts.en: Ehab is a 23-year-old university student majoring in Law, and he is a fourth year. He is a single young man living in Irbid-Jordan with his family that consists of four. His father is a retired man whom is pension isn’t enough to cover his children's needs. Now Ehab is seeking to get his Bachelor’s so that he will be able to work in his field, and he needs a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fee.

loans.name: Sladjana

texts.en: Sladana has one adult son and while her husband works for an electrical company her son is employed in a private company in the area. Between the two incomes, the money they are generating is still not enough to meet their needs and be able to save or complete any repairs. She has tried several times to do some renovations in the house, but without success to save. For this reason she is requesting a loan to do the insulation of her house so she can save money on electricity during the winter and decrease time being sick from the conditions. She considers this loan very helpful and is relieved to not have to ask relatives for any money. Her goal is that her son will get married and have children soon so she can help care for the children. She wants to thank all of the lenders for the support.

loans.use: To do the insulation of her house so she can save money on electricity during the winter and decrease time being sick from the conditions.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more supplies for his garment business.

loans.name: Yessica Marlene

texts.es: Yessica de 26 años de edad habita junto a su compañero de vida y su hijo de 4 años de edad en vivienda propia. Ella se esfuerza todos los días por salir adelante junto a su familia por medio de su pequeño negocio de venta de artículos básicos, además su compañero de vida aporta económicamente gracias a su trabajo. Yessica desea construir una acera en los alrededores de su vivienda ya que como se puede observar en la fotografía es el área de atención de su pequeño negocio, además cuando llueve la tierra retiene el agua y esta se filtra, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir una acera en los alrededores de su vivienda.
texts.en: Yessica is 26 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their 4 year old son in her own home. She strives every day to get ahead with her family through her little business selling basic items. Her life's companion also contributes financially thanks to his work. Yessica wants to build a wall around her house. In the photograph, the area where she operates her little business can be seen. When it rains, the soil retains the water and it filters through. That is why she is asking FUSAI for a loan to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a wall around her house.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel and bricks to build a wall around her house.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es: Isabel es una señora de 47 años de edad, casada y madre de dos hijos ya independientes de ella, que con muchísimo esfuerzo a logrado formar su propio negocio y con dedicación lo ha mantenido en pie para salir adelante y ser el sustento de su familia. Hoy en día Isabel de desea solicitar un préstamo para comprar mercadería como golosinas, arroz, azúcar, aceite, frijoles, detergentes, jabones entre otros productos ya que gracias a su negocio ella ha podido sobrellevar las necesidades de su familia. Ella estima que el préstamo a solicitud le será de muchísima ayuda que podrá hacer crecer su negocio, podrá obtener más ganancias para reinvertirlas nuevamente en su local de trabajo y suplir las necesidades básicas de su hogar, entre sus principales metas están mejorar las condiciones de su hogar y sus planes futuros son la ampliar un poco más su casa y su negocio.
texts.en: Isabel is a 47 year old woman. She is married and the mother of two children who are grown. With a lot of hard work, she has been able to have her own business and has kept it going to get ahead and support her family. Now Isabel wants to take out a loan to buy merchandise such as candies, rice, beans, detergent, soap, and other products. Thanks to her business, she has been able to take care of her family's needs. She thinks that the loan she has asked for will be a big help that will grow her business. She will be able to obtain more profits to reinvest them in her work place and cover her home's basic needs. Among her main goals is improving her living conditions, and her future plans are to enlarge her house and her business a little.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like candies, rice, sugar, oil, beans, detergent, soap and other products.

loans.name: Alphonsine

texts.en: Alphonsine is 22 years old. She is married with one child who is four years old and not yet going to school. She sells food stuff and has been running this business for the past four years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava for sale. The profits from the business will be used for reinvestment and to buy food for her children.

loans.use: to buy more potatoes, bananas and cassava to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to put the façade on the house, before the upcoming cold winter and increase in rain and snow.

loans.name: Joaquin

texts.es: Don Joaquín, tiene 60 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su familia en el municipio de Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara.  Lleva aproximadamente 45 años de dedicarse a la producción de miel de abeja. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa, la vende en la comunidad. Ha invertido varios prestamos en su negocio para mantenerlo activo. El que solicita actualmente es por 20,000 lempiras para comprar madera y cera para la elaboración de más colmenas. Su plan es obtener buena producción de miel y aumentar sus ganancias para brindarle un mejor bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Joaquín is sixty years old and married. He has two children and lives with his family in Nueva Frontera, Santa Bárbara. He has been producing honey at home for approximately 45 years. He sells it to locals.

Joaquín has invested several loans in his business in order to keep it alive. He is now requesting a loan of 20,000 lempiras [HNL] to buy wood and wax in order to make more hives. His plan is to have a good production of honey and increase his profits to better provide for his family.

loans.use: to buy wood and wax to make more hives.

loans.name: Aissatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupement est composé de femmes très engagées qui ont su développer depuis la création du banc villageois le 06 Juin 2002 en plus des activités génératrices de revenues essentiellement tournées vers le petit commerce. Elles partagent des liens forts de solidarité et d’entre aide puisse que vivant dans le même village depuis des décennies.

Madame Aïssatou (assise à  droite avec une main levée), est l’emprunteuse vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, mère de 05 enfants dont 04 filles et un garçon qui sont âgés de 09 à 17 ans. Elle évolue dans le commerce de tissus et de prêt à porter pour enfant. Elle s’approvisionne au près de commerçants dans les marchés de la capitale. Pour la revente soit au comptant lors de « loumas » marchés hebdomadaires et à crédit par deux échéances aux clients de son village. De plus elle a acheté un frigo pour la vente de glace, du jus de fruit à base de produits locaux et crème glacée pour enfants.

Avec son nouveau prêt, elle compte acheter 15 sacs de pain de singe à 7 000 Fr CFA l’un, du bissap par bassine, du sucre et divers colorants alimentaires.

Avec les bénéfices, elle compte de venir en aide à son mari dans la gestion quotidienne des charges de la famille, surtout assurer la prise en charge des frais scolaires des enfants.
texts.en:
This group is made up of highly committed women who, since the inauguration of their banc villageois on 6th June 2002, have skilfully developed their revenue-generating activities, which focus mainly on small-scale retail ventures. They are held together by the bonds of solidarity and mutual aid, as they have all lived in the same village for several decades.

Aissatou (the woman sat on the right with her hand raised) is the group's star borrower. She is a married mother to four daughters and one son, who are aged between 9 and 17 years old. She works as a vendor of fabrics and ready-to-wear children's clothings. She gets her supplies from the market dealers found in the capital. She trades in exchange for cash at the "loumas", the weekly markets, or for credit with the people of her village. She has also purchased a refrigerator so she can sell ice, fruit juices made from local produce and ice cream for children.

With this new loan, she is planning on purchasing 15 7000 FCFA sacks of baobab fruit, bowls of hibiscus flowers, sugar and various food colourings.

With the profits from this venture, she is planning on assisting her husband with their family's daily expenses, most importantly with paying for their children's school fees.

loans.use: to purchase 15 7000 FCFA sacks of baobab fruit, bowls of hibiscus flowers, sugar and various food colourings

loans.name: Zelda

texts.en: Zelda is 60 years old. She is married with 3 children aged between 30 and 27 years, all of them are married. She has been selling sorghum for the past 12 years. With the loan requested, she would like to buy more sorghum to sell. The profits from the business will be used to buy land for rearing cattle and to buy food for home consumption.

loans.use: to buy more sorghum to sell.

loans.name: Haifa

texts.en: Haifa is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Nursing, and she is in her first year. She lives with her family in Irbid, Jordan. Haifa is planning to finish her studies so that she may start working in her field to support her family financially after the financial problems they have faced. However she does not have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. This is why she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Amer

texts.en: Amer is a 27-year-old university student majoring in Business Administration, and he is in his fourth year. He also works in the evenings at a private company to assist in paying for his upcoming semester fees. He is seeking to get his Bachelors' to be able to settle in his current work. Despite this, Amer still does not have enough money to pay for his semester fees. This is why he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Civil Engineering, and he is in his third year. He lives with his family in Baqaa, Jordan. Mahmoud also works in the evenings in journalism. He is planning to get his Bachelors' degree to be able to further his studies and get his Masters' degree. However he does not have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. This is why he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Samir

texts.en: Samir is 37 years old and is the father of 2 children. He is a very hardworking man who does a lot in order to support his family. He works in construction. He is also involved in agriculture. He plants wheat and corn on his land and also works on the land of others for a fee. He has been doing this type of work for a long time but his tools and tractor are now worn and old from the wear and tear. He is requesting a loan in order to repair and purchase new tools for his tractor so that he can continue to work hard at a more effective and efficient rate. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all the lenders for this opportunity and support

loans.use: to repair and purchase new tools for his tractor.

loans.name: Abdullah

texts.en: Abdullah is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his first year. He is a single young man living in Wihdat, Jordan with his family. He also works in the evenings at a desserts shop. Abdullah is seeking to get his Bachelors’ degree so that he may work in his field, and he currently needs a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Aleksandra

texts.en: Aleksandra is 26 years old and single, living with her parents in one of the minority communities of Kosovo. She works in a clinic as a nurse and her father is a cleaner in a school. She loves her parents very much and wants to improve their living conditions. Since the house they are living in is very old and has not been repaired or renovated due to lack of income, she is requesting a loan to renovate and build the façade of the house. She is very happy to have this opportunity to be able to help her parents and promises to pay on time. She wants to thank all of the lenders for their support.

loans.use: to renovate and build the façade for the house.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase wood for heating and a stove.

loans.name: Hussein

texts.en: Hussein is a 21-year-old university student majoring in Physics, and he is in his second semester of his third year. He is a single young man living in Mafraq, Jordan with his family that consists of nine. His father is a retired man whose pension is not enough to cover his children's needs. Now Hussein is seeking to get his Bachelors’ degree so that he may work in his field, and he needs a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Akpédzé

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Akpédzé  est âgée de  27 ans,  elle est mariée  sans enfant. Akpédzé est couturière de formation, donc elle achète des pagnes pour coudre des habits qu’elle  vend  après, et vend aussi  des pagnes. Elle s’approvisionne  2 fois  par mois  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle  les revend  par vente ambulante.  Akpédzé  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Residing in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, 27-year-old Akpédzé is married without children. Akpédzé is a trained seamstress. She purchases pagne cloth to make clothing which she then sells on. She also sells pagne cloth. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé twice every month. She sells her goods as a street vendor. Akpédzé is requesting this loan so that she can grow her business and bring in more profits.

loans.use: to purchase three sheets of pagne cloth

loans.name: Améyo

texts.fr: Agée de 31 ans,  demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, elle est  mariée  et  mère  d’un enfant. Améyo   vend  les savons, des détergents et  s’approvisionne  3 fois  par mois au grand  marché de Lomé et  les revend au marché d’Assiyéyé.  Améyo  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et réaliser plus  de profit.
texts.en: Residing in the Adidogomé district of Lomé, 31-year-old Améyo is a married mother to one child. She sells soaps and detergents. She gets her supplies from the main market in Lomé three times every month. She then sells her stock at the market in Assiyéyé. Améyo is requesting this loan in order to grow her business and make a larger profit.

loans.use: to purchase 5 boxes of mosquito spray and 10 boxes of detergent

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy items such as plastic, soap, toothbrushes, toothpaste and shoe polish, in bulk, to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy galvanized metal plates, poles and stop pins to expand the roof over her open-air porch.

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard, 32, is married to Carolyne, and they do not yet have children. He has been selling secondhand shoes for the last 12 years and earns a monthly income of 25, 000 KES.
	 
He has applied for his third loan of 70,000 KES from VisionFund Kenya, and he intends to use the loan to buy more secondhand shoes to sell.                                                                                          

Richard will use the anticipated profits to provide for his family's basic needs. He hopes to grow his business and open a bigger shop where he can sell shoes wholesale.

loans.use: to buy more secondhand shoes to sell.

loans.name: Obaida

texts.en: Obaida is a 19-year-old university student majoring in Finance, and he is in his second year. He lives with his family which consists of seven members in Irbid-Jordan. His father works at a hospital. Obaida is seeking to improve his studies till he gets his bachelor’s degree, but he doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. He is applying for this loan for that purpose.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Huru

texts.en: Huru, 58, is married with two kids. She is engaged in selling milk. She has 3 cows now. Huru and her husband are IDP (Internally Displaced Persons) and they live in the Bilasuvar IDP Settlement. The income her business generates is about 200 AZN per month, but it is too low to cover the basic demands of her family. Milk and dairy products are very popular in Azerbaijan, and that is why Huru decided to purchase an additional cow and calf. Additional livestock will help Huru to cover her customers' demands, increase income and thereby improve the living conditions of her family. Her loan request is 1,500 AZN. Please support Huru.

loans.use: to purchase an additional cow and calf.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy palm oil, onions, margi, salt, pepper, rice, sugar, flour, and other items in bulk to add to her current stock.

loans.name: Khaled

texts.en: Khaled is a 21-year-old single young man living in Zarqa, Jordan with his family which consists of five members. He is a university student majoring in Mechanical Engineering, and he is in his second year. His father works at a governmental entity. Khaled is seeking to get his Bachelors' degree so that he may work in his study field. He is now seeking a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he is facing a financial crisis.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Negba Peace Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Regina is the representative of the group called Negba Peace. She is married and the mother of one child dependent.

The group members sell jewelry, eggs, yam, rice, shampoo and corn dough.

Mrs. Regina been selling jewelry for six years. She gets her products from the local jewelry producers in her are. She wants to purchase more and sell it to customers far from her town. She normally supplies to women in the market on a cash basis. The demand from her customers is so much that she needs financial assistance to buy more and sell to her customers.

Mrs. Regina wants to use her profits for reinvestment and also continue supporting her home and her child's education. She hopes to expand her business and better care for her family and, above all, to prepare for her child's future. In the photograph, she is standing in the middle.

loans.use: to purchase more jewelry and sell it to customers far from her town.

loans.name: Ghaida

texts.en: Ghaida is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Soil and Irrigation. Her father is a retired man, and his pension is not enough to pay for her upcoming semester fees. Ghaida is seeking to finish her studies so that she can start working in her field to be a second provider for her family. She is now requesting a loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees because she is facing a financial crisis which is not helping her to do so.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Ali

texts.en: Ali is a 21-year-old single man living in Irbid, Jordan with his family that consists of six members. He is a university student majoring in Biology, and he is in his third year. Ali is planning to work in his study field after he gets his Bachelors' degree. However he currently does not have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. This is why he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en: Mohammad is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Special Education, and he is in his second year. He is a single young man living in Mafraq-Jordan with his family that consists of seven members. Now Mohammad is seeking to get his bachelor’s degree so that he will be able to work in his field, but he needs a loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Nachima

texts.en:
Nachima is a 54-year-old lady. She is an illiterate widow who lost her husband a few years ago. She lives with her only son in their own house in Baroghoria village in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her son is a student of grade 11.

Nachima's husband used to run a grocery store very adjacent to their house. After his death, Nachima had no other choice but to continue running the store for a livelihood. After she manages her household work, she looks after her shop for the well-being of her family. She buys material for her store from wholesalers in the local market and then resells it. She wishes to buy additional food items for her store in order to avoid any out-of-stock situations, as well as items that are currently unavailable at her store. Due to a shortage of money, she has requested a loan from BJS, a Kiva partner, to help her to increase her business.

She is ambitious about her business and wishes to increase it by buying additional items that are more in demand (rice, salt, sugar, biscuits, noodles, flour etc.) Also, she wants to make sure that customers do not go to other shops due to shortages or the unavailability of a particular item at her shop. This will help her attract more customers and increase her sales. She is hopeful that the loan will be a fruitful one and will help her to grow her business to fulfill her goals, which include providing a higher education to her only son.

She conveys her hearty thanks to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase grocery items for her grocery shop.

loans.name: Minati

texts.en:
Minati is an enterprising woman from Dhupguri.  She is 26 years old, married and blessed with three children (one son and two daughters).  Two of them are students of grade 1 and grade 3; the other is an infant.  Minati is an illiterate woman who can only sign her name.  But this shortcoming could not curb the determination and energy of this young lady to get ahead in life.  They live in Promodnagar, a remote village in Jalpaiguri district, in their own kachha house (mud, bamboo and straw made).

Minati's husband is engaged in a decorating business. He supplies decorating items for marriage ceremonies, birthday parties and other occasions. Minati is engaged in a cattle-rearing business.  She has a dairy cow in her herd and she supplies milk to her neighbors.  She works hard in order to supplement their family incomes and provide a better future for their children.  She wants to improve her living conditions by adding basic necessities like water and sanitation facilities to her home.  She realizes the urgency of earning more and seeks to expand her small business as the first step towards meeting her goals.

Being unable to collect the required capital for the expansion soon enough, she seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva’s partner).  She will use the loan to purchase another cow for the attainment of her purpose.

She wants to purchase lands with the profit in the future and she gives her thanks to her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her milk-selling business.

loans.name: Dipti

texts.en:
Dipti hails from Dhupguri. She is a woman of 24 years. She has a secondary education. She is married to 25-year-old Harinath, who deals in wood. Dipti is a homemaker who lives with her husband and a toddler in West Magurmari, a remote village in West Bengal.

Dipti's husband has been working hard to manage his timber business, which sells wood and timber. They have a small wood shop near their house. He started up the business using his own funds and began by purchasing wood from the wholesale market and selling to the local carpentry shops and local people. This young couple hopes to grow their small business so that they can improve their income and work towards financial stability, a goal that will help them improve their living standards.

So Dipti seeks a loan from BJS to invest in her husband's business. Your loan will help this couple increase their sales and increase their earnings, setting them on the first step to creating a stable family environment with good living conditions and savings. 

The goals she has set are to construct a better and decent house for them and provide her children with good education.

She is thankful to both BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase more wood for her husband's timber business.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 22-year-old university student majoring in Space Engineering. He also works in installing tiles in the evenings and on holidays. Ahmad is seeking to finish his studies in order to work in his study field to gain better income, but he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his upcoming semester fees. For that purpose, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Maneka

texts.en:
Maneka is 39 years old and is staying with her husband and her only son. They live in a remote village Dangapara in Jalpaiguri. Both Maneka and her husband are uneducated and can sign their names only. Due to poverty they could not provide education to their son. He is unemployed.

Her husband has been involved in vegetable and paddy farming for a long time. Maneka helps her husband in sowing and harvesting the crop. Her husband got the idea of doing paddy cultivation from his father. He started paddy cultivation on a small scale. He has developed a very good relationship with his customers in the village, as he sells fresh and high-quality paddy rice. He likes the fact that he can cater to the needs of the people in his village. Now, to generate more income, he wants to expand his paddy cultivation.

Maneka wants to help her husband. She came to know about BJS and has taken a loan from them to purchase agricultural materials such as seeds, fertilizers, and pesticides. She hopes this loan will grow their paddy cultivation and provide them with financial sustenance.

Her dream is to upgrade their mud and straw made house to a concrete and mortar made house in the future with the profit.

She thanks her lenders.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to expand paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Pratima

texts.en:
Thirty-nine-year-old Pratima hails from Dhupguri. She is married and is blessed with three children. Two of them are students in different grades. Her elder son is unemployed. Pratima is a housewife. With a great deal of effort, she managed to study to the sixth grade of secondary school. They live in a remote village, Barmanpara in Jalpaiguri district.

Pratima is a hardworking and energetic lady who, together with her husband, Mahesh, is slowly forming her household. Mahesh is a farmer. Pratima helps her husband in cultivation while she manages her household work. Their major crops include potatoes, eggplant, lady's finger, gourds, etc. In order to generate additional resources, they want to grow paddy on their farmland.

She is a responsible woman. In order to increase production, she found it necessary to apply for a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to purchase agricultural supplies, such as fertilizers, paddy seed and different agrochemicals. Thus, she will be able to increase production and improve her living conditions.

She aspires to purchase a car from her profit in the future, and she is very much grateful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase good quality paddy seeds and fertilizers to grow paddy.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, Kiva lenders! Meet Mary, 37, a very hardworking and honest farmer based in Mwiria, a remote village in the Chuka area of Kenya. She is happily married, and together with her husband, she is blessed with four lovely children. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming, and her primary source of income has been milk, eggs, and tea. She also engages in a personal business to supplement her meager income. She passionately loves dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of her cows “Gatune.” Waking up every day in the morning to milk “Gatune” (the name of her cow) makes her feel very fulfilled and proud. 

The biggest challenge she faces is feeding her cows and satisfying the largely unsatisfied milk market. She is seeking a loan to start zero grazing (stall feeding her dairy cows).

Mary is a mobilizer, she mobilized other women in her village and formed the “Vision Ngumu” self-help group, and together, they have undergone training on technical and financial management. Through training from Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance institution that assists aspiring women, she has ignited her keen entrepreneurial spirit. Through the loan, she will be able to build a profitable business enterprise. Zero grazing will allow her make more money in selling milk, and she projects that milk will be selling at 45 KES (Kenyan shillings) per liter and KES 55 for fermented milk. An increase in income means she will be able to comfortably support her large household and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To start zero grazing (stall feeding her dairy cows)

loans.name: Yolanda Lilian

texts.es: Yolanda de 62 años de edad es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su hija y 4 nietos. Ella es una mujer que gracias ha su tenacidad ha logrado sacar adelante a sus hijos y ahora apoya a sus nietos, Yolanda cuenta con una pupuserìa, negocio que le ha permitido sostenerse durante los últimos 7 años posicionándose en el gusto de sus clientes que siempre buscan sus productos, gracias a su extensa experiencia en la elaboración de este platillo como son las pupusas. Ella ha observado que las láminas de su vivienda se encuentran deterioradas lo que provoca que el agua se filtre y es por ello que Yolanda solicita un crédito a FUSAI para comprar: lámina galvanizada y pines para cambiar las láminas deterioradas de su vivienda.
texts.en:
Yolanda is 62 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter and 4 grandchildren. Thanks to her tenacity she has managed to help her children get ahead in life and she is now supporting her grandchildren. Yolanda owns a food stand where she sells pupusas, a traditional Salvadoran dish. This business has allowed her to support herself for the past 7 years and is very well-liked by customers thanks to Yolanda's extensive experience in making pupusas.

Yolanda has noticed that the metal plates that make up the roof of her home are deteriorating and allowing water to leak through. That is why she is asking for a loan from FUSAI [Kiva Field Partner] to buy galvanized metal plates and stop pins to replace the deteriorated metal plates of her current roof.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal plates and stop pins to replace the deteriorated metal plates of her current roof.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy farm implements

loans.name: Marcella

texts.en:
The above picture presents to you Marcella, a very dedicated, honest and self-driven farmer. She is 40 years of age and full of energy. She is based in Nyosia, a remote area in the rich highlands of Kisii. She is a dedicated mother and has single-handedly raised her three children, although not in very good circumstances, but she has always put on a brave face. 

Marcella's primary source of income is selling a variety of food crops and milk. She also engages in some personal business to make ends meet. Dairy farming is a profitable business venture in the Kisii area, and the demand is great. Marcella wants to take advantage and diversify her farming by acquiring an exotic breed of dairy cow. She is seeking a loan to buy a quality dairy cow. 

Marcella is an enterprising woman and wants not only to buy a cow, but she intends to buy a quality cow that will be producing between 10-20 liters of milk a day. Through the cow she will increase her income level and also increase her profit. Through Juhudi Kilimo, Marcella received financial training and has mastered all aspects of savings. Saved profits will be used in repaying the loan and increasing her business. She intends to start a yoghurt and cream selling business. Increased profits from the loan will also allow her start a bio-gas plant in her compound, hence saving costs spent on fuel. In the long run, Marcella will be able to improve her standard of living and secure the future of her children.

loans.use: To buy a quality breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Nargiza

texts.ru: Наргиза порядочная и жизнерадостная девушка. Ей 19 лет. Она студентка первого курса Технического Института Технологического Университета Таджикистана. Наргиза учится в факультете Мировая экономика. Она является одной из успешных студентов и учится в очное отделение. Наргиза очень умная. Она и в средней школе тоже училась успешно и всегда получала отличные оценки. Она должна оплатить за свое обучение, но не имеет денег. Наргиза запрашивает займ для оплаты учебного договора. Она ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Nargiza is a respectable and joyful woman. She is 19 years old. She is a first-year student at the Technical Institute of the Tajikistan Technological University. Nargiza studies in the Global Economics Department. She is one of the best students and studies on campus. Nargiza is very smart. She also did very well in secondary school and always received good grades. She needs to pay for her education but she does not have the money. Nargiza is requesting a loan to pay for her tuition. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to pay for her university tuition.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is 29 years old. She is married with three children aged between 1 and 6, one of whom goes to school. She has been farming for 11 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more fertiliser for rice. The profits from the business will be used to build a new house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy more fertiliser for rice.

loans.name: Mensur

texts.en:
Mensur is single and lives with his parents in a small town. He is the main source of income for them, earning a living working as an accountant but with a small salary. Until now, they have never had a chance to improve their living conditions and repair or renovate their old small home. 

Mensur wants to help his parents and give them a better environment to live in, so he is asking for a loan to make these repairs and renovations. He is very happy to have this opportunity and promises to repay on time. Knowing that this is a Kiva loan, he wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: To make repairs and renovations in his house

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 20-year-old ambitious man whose aim is to support his family and to depend on himself. He is a university student majoring in Arabic Language, and he is in his second year. He lives in Baqaa, Jordan with his retired parents and his siblings. 

Ahmad is seeking to continue his studies till he gets his Master's so that he can use his education in finding a good job in his study field from which he will earn good income. But he doesn't have enough money to pay his upcoming semester fees in view of the financial crisis his family has been facing. For that reason, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Maria Virginia

texts.es: Virginia es una chica que a su corta edad de 17 años ya le apasiona en mundo empresarial es par tal razón que ella ha decido estudiar secretariado ejecutivo por siente que su vocación esta en esa rama del mundo empresarial. Virginia sabe que estudiando alcanzara el éxito y por eso ella necesita de un préstamo para realizar los pagos de mensualidad de su carrera técnica y comprarse una computadora. Estimando que el préstamo a solicitud le será de mucha ayuda podrá hacer los pagos pertinentes y obteniendo la computadora se le hará más fácil elaborar todos sus trabajos asignados. Sus principales metas están enfocadas en terminar su carrera técnica y en futuro ingresar en una universidad a nivel nacional y estudiar Marketing y Publicidad
texts.en:
Virginia, 17, is a young lady who is passionate about the business world.  That is why she studied to be an executive secretary, which is where her true vocation lies.  She knows that by studying she will become successful, so she is requesting a loan to pay the monthly tuition for her technical degree and to buy a computer.  She believes the loan will be very helpful in making the corresponding payments and the computer which will make it easier for her to do her homework.

Her main goals are to finish her technical degree and to study Marketing and Publicity in the future at a university on the national level.

loans.use: To pay the monthly tuition for her technical degree and to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en: Mahmoud is 20 years old. He lives in Irbid, Jordan, with his family. Mahmoud is a university student majoring in Air Conditioning Engineering, and he is in his third year. Mahmoud is seeking to expand his studies until he gets his Master's. Now he is requesting a loan that will help him pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Aliman

texts.en:
Aliman is a distinctive and hardworking woman who hails from Dhupguri, a small city in the Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal. She is 54 years old and studied till grade 2. She resides at Magurmari, a rural region, with her husband and four school-going children (two sons and two daughters). They are in different grades in primary and secondary level.

Aliman's husband, Sahidar, is a mason by profession. He has no regular job and as a result, his inconsistent income is insufficient to bear all the costs of a six-member family. That's why Aliman started a milk supply business. She sells cow milk to the local people to earn for the family. She has been running this business for the last seven years.

Aliman has asked for a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. The loan will help her to buy a dairy cow and that will increase their family income and will also help her in planning a better future for their children. Along with this, she will be able to save money in case of emergencies. If the assistance she asked for is provided to her, it surely will change her life.

She thanks BJS and Kiva greatly.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for her existing milk supply business.

loans.name: Manoyara

texts.en:
Manoyara hails from Dhupguri. She is a married, 40-year-old woman. She is a kind, responsive, polite and hardworking wife. She lives in a small village Madjidpara in the district of Jalpaiguri. Her family consists of her husband and two children (one son and one daughter) who are students of grade 8 and grade 11. Manoyara studied till primary school and could not proceed further because her parents could not afford it.

Manoyara's husband, Nur, is a carpenter who makes and sells small wooden furniture. To help her husband bear the household expenses, Manoyara has been involved in an animal husbandry business for few years. Manoyara provides the food and takes care of the livestock herself. She fattens up the livestock and sells its milk to her neighbors. Now she decided to expand her milk selling business. She requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to buy a dairy cow.

She hopes the loan will increase her business profitability, which would help with improving her living conditions.

She has a dream to construct a decent and better house with the savings from her profit.

She is thankful to her generous lenders.

loans.use: To purchase a dairy cow for enhancing her milk selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay tuition and graduation fees.

loans.name: Alix Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Alix tiene gran experiencia en el área de cocina, hace algún tiempo inicio con su propia pizzería en el municipio de Sahagún, Córdoba.

Siempre ha preferido trabajar independiente, trabaja todos los días desde las 8:00 Am hasta las 9:00 Pm, pero en ocasiones recibe la ayuda de una persona en su local.
 
Actualmente necesita un auxilio económico para realizar adecuaciones a su local ya que este necesita algunas reformas porque al cocinar las pizzas se llena todo el local de humo y vapor y esto hace que sea muy caluroso.

El préstamo le permitirá trabajar en unas mejores condiciones y podrá garantizar la calidad de sus preparaciones y un buen servicio para sus clientes.

Su mayor sueño es poder tener una gran pizzería que sea prospera y reconocida.

Con esta ayuda podrá trabajar de una manera más organizada teniendo en cuenta que para este tipo de negocios se necesitan algunas condiciones especiales.
texts.en:
Alix has much experience in the area of cooking and some time ago she started her own pizza shop in the municipality of Sahagún, Córdoba.  She always has enjoyed working independently and has a schedule from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m.  Sometimes another person helps out at the shop.

She currently is in need of a loan to carry out renovations at her shop, which gets too hot with the smoke and steam from cooking the pizzas.  The loan will allow her to work under better conditions, guaranteeing a quality product and better service to her customers.

Her greatest dream is to have a successful, well-known pizza shop.  This support will help her become more organized since this type of business requires some special conditions.

loans.use: To renovate her shop so she can prepare better pizzas and improve her service.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy clothes, handbags, shoes, and blankets for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing and footwear

loans.name: Ahmed

texts.en: Ahmed is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Chemical Technology, and he is in his third year. He is a single young man living in Zarqa, Jordan with his family. Ahmed is seeking to get his Bachelor's so that he will be able to work in his field. But his father is a retired man whose pension isn't enough to cover his children's needs. Now Ahmed is requesting a loan that will help him pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay his next semester fees.

loans.name: Ibush

texts.en: Ibush is 24 years old and single. He lives with his parents and is blind. In the picture he is shown with his mother. His family’s only income is the social help that they receive. Now, Ibush has had the idea that it would be in their best interest if they could start a business of keeping cows and sell the milk and dairy products in the neighborhood. He will need a loan to build a stable and purchase 2 milk cows. He is very positive and optimistic that this business will generate a decent income and his mother is very happy for this opportunity to start working. He hopes that this business will allow them to live on more than just the social help. His family is very grateful for this opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to build a stable and purchase 2 milk cows.

loans.name: Anjali

texts.en:
Anjali hails from Dhupguri. She is a very active young lady, 29 years of age. She lives with her husband, one son and two daughters. She and her husband are illiterate and can sign their names only.  Her husband, Upeswar, is a farmer by profession. Two of her children are students. They live in a kachha house (made of mud, straw and wood) in a small village named Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district.

Her husband has a vegetable cultivation farm on his own land. Anjali and her husband manage the farm. Her husband is an active and cheerful farmer. They produce vegetables like brinjal (eggplant), cauliflower, carrots, cabbage, chilies, cucumbers, papaya, lady’s finger, onions, etc. on the farm. They sell the products to the traders from the nearest town who come to take the vegetables from her farm. 

Now they have decided to cultivate paddy rice to increase their income, as paddy rice is very profitable and in great demand in West Bengal.

Anjali wants to expand her business by taking a loan from Kiva's partner BJS. She will use the loan to buy fertilizer and farm inputs such as paddy seeds and pesticides for her farm. She expects a good return from her business by expanding her cultivation. 

Anjali dreams of constructing a concrete and mortar-made house. She also hopes to give her whole family a bright future through her hard work.

Her full thanks go to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural supplies like seeds and fertilizers for cultivating paddy rice.

loans.name: Pashke

texts.en:
Pashke is a villager and a married mother of two who has built a little family home recently, but she was short of money to do further work such as tiling, plastering the walls, installing electricity, etc. Pashke and her family live in rural northern Albania where the bitter cold and the snowy weather are about to kick in very soon, thus, she considers it urgent to complete some of the work in any case.
  
She owns a van that is rented it out to some neighbors and her husband works as a van driver; thus, both of them earn an income of approximately $300/month for the moment, while their children are grownups and work for themselves. 

Pashke will be very appreciative to all potential lenders for their financial help and consideration to her situation.

loans.use: to do some renovation to their family home

loans.name: Binata

texts.en:
Binata, a 24-year-old woman, hails from Dhupguri. She is married. She resides with her husband and they are blessed with two children (one son and one daughter). Her son is in school and her daughter is too young for school.

Binata's husband is a cycle-van puller who carries loads and people. His income is hardly enough for the family.  Energetic and hardworking Binata was very much eager to give financial support to her family. So she has been actively involved in dairy farming. She sells milk to her neighbors and to the tea shops in the local market. Binata is appreciative that the dairy business is a good, sustainable source of income. However, lack of capital has held her back for a while.

Binata is seeking a loan from BJS to purchase a dairy cow. The additional dairy cow will provide her lots of practical benefits. The most obvious is that she will be able to produce more milk and increase her sales volume. With the extra money she will get from the increased sales, she will save for her children's educational expenses. With the profit of her business, she hopes to accomplish her life’s goals, which are to elevate her family’s quality of life and purchase more cows for her herd.

She is thankful to her generous lenders BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a cow for her existing dairy business.

loans.name: Dira Group

texts.en:
Rehema is aged in her late thirties and has got three schooling children. She is married and, since 2004, she has been managing two businesses. One is a grocery selling beers, spirits, and non-alcoholic drinks. A beauty salon is her second project, where she needs to do some innovation. Rehema works  from 8 AM to midnight on working days and is able to realize a good profit per month. 

From Tujijenge Tanzania, this is her second loan request which she will use to buy salon equipment and drinks for her grocery. She used the previous credit, since repaid, to start her new salon project and bought drinks stock. Rehema received an extra income which she used to cover household expenses and school fees. Rehema dreams to be a successful businesswoman. 

She will share this loan with her loan group, Dira,  which consist of four members. The members of the group will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment and drinks for her grocery.

loans.name: Oyatullo

texts.ru: Оятулло вырос в сельской местности. Его родители занимаются разведением скота и выращиванием сельхоз культур. Оятулло с детства привык к тяжелому труду, так как он с детства помогал родителям выращиванию сельхоз культур. Его родители не имели возможность получить высшее образование, поэтому мечтали дать сыну высшее образование, и это мечта сбылась благодаря их поддержке и желанием самого Оятулло в прошлом году, когда он поступил в Таджикский Государственный Университет Коммерции. Оятулло учится в факультете Мировая экономика. Он является одним из успешных студентов и получает хорошие оценки. Оятулло запрашивает займ на сумму 800 долларов США для оплаты учебного договора. Он ждет вашу доброту.
texts.en: Oyatullo grew up in the countryside. His parents raise cattle and grow crops. From childhood, Oyatullo has been used to hard work, as he has helps his parents with their crop farming from a young age. His parents did not have the opportunity to receive a higher education, which is why they dreamed of giving their son a university education. This dream came true thanks to their support and Oyatullo's desire to attend university. Last year, Oyatullo enrolled in the Tajik State University of Commerce. Oyatullo studies in the Global Economics Department. He is one of the best students and receives good grades. Oyatullo is requesting a loan for 800 USD to pay for his university tuition. He awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To pay for his university education

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is 32 years old. He is married with four children aged between 4 and 12, and all of them go to school. He has been farming for 10 years. With the loan from Kiva, he would like to buy more fertilizers for rice production. The profits from the business will be used to renovate his house.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: To buy more fertilizers for rice production.

loans.name: Marie Gorithe

texts.en:
Marie Goritte, 29, is married with 1 child who does not yet go to school. She has been farming for 4 years. With the loan from Kiva, she would like to buy more rice fertilizers. The profits from the business will be used to improve her welfare.

The agriculture sector accounts for 37% of Rwanda's gross domestic product, generates 65% of Rwanda's export revenue, and employs approximately 90% of Rwandans (as of 2009). Despite the importance of agriculture to Rwandans and their economy, financial institutions view lending to fund agricultural activities as a high-risk proposition because the profitability of these activities is affected by weather, natural disasters, and price fluctuations. For this reason, farmers in Rwanda remain underserved by financial institutions. Urwego Opportunity Bank is expanding into this market and is happy to provide Kiva lenders with the opportunity to support Rwandan farmers.

loans.use: to buy rice fertilizers.

loans.name: José Carlos

texts.es:
José de 63 años de edad, estudio hasta segundo grado de básica, está casado y su esposa se dedica a los oficios domésticos y administra el molino que tienen en su casa; son padres de dos hijos uno depende aun de él, mientras tanto el otro no que es hembra.

José trabaja con un molino en su casa y trabaja la agricultura y ganadería, trabajo que hace desde temprana edad.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar fertilizantes para la milpa.  Sueña con poder darle el estudio a su hija, que se prepare academicamente para que tenga un buen futuro.
texts.en:
José is 63 and has a second grade education.  He is married and his wife is a homemaker and manages the mill they have at home.  They have two children, an independent daughter and a dependent son.

José works in the mill at home and also has been a farmer since he was young.

The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizers for his cornfield.  His dream is to give his daughter an education so she can get academic training and have a better future.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cornfield.  He dreams of giving his daughter an education so she will have a better future.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is from Dhupguri. She is 41 years old and a housewife. She lives with her husband and four daughters in Baroghoria in Jalpaiguri district. She attended till second standard in primary school and could not continue further study because of her parents' poverty. Her husband, 50-year-old Maphijul, is engaged in agricultural activities. Three of her daughters are students and one is too young for school.

Amina's husband is a dedicated farmer who concentrates mainly on paddy cultivation and is struggling hard for everyday living. With the help of Amina, he works on his farmland from dawn to dusk to grow good quality paddy rice. They sell the agricultural products in the local market, which is the most important source of the family’s income.

To continue running their agribusiness in a sustainable way, Amina seeks a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) in order to purchase farm inputs such as paddy seeds, fertilizers, pesticides etc. The loan is very important for Amina for further improvement of her plantation business. 

Amina hopes to make a lot of profit from their business so that she will be able to provide a better living and also to meet their essential needs. Amina and her family rely on the good will of the lenders and will be very thankful to them for their support.

loans.use: To purchase agricultural inputs for paddy cultivation.

loans.name: Anima

texts.en:
Anima is a rural housewife from the village Ashrampara in Jalpaiguri district of West Bengal.  She is 26 years old and a mother of two sons. She lives with her husband and sons in their own mud and bamboo house, which lacks of basic amenities like water and electricity. She has a secondary education whereas her husband has higher secondary education. One of her sons reads in grade 3 and the other is an infant.

Anima's husband, Biswajit, age 32, is engaged in cultivation of potatoes, eggplants, gourds, cucumbers, and tomatoes. With the help of Anima, who is a housewife and looks after household works, he sells his products in the local market, the main source of the family's income. 

To continue running their agribusiness in a sustainable way and to improve his earnings, he has decided to grow paddy rice on his farmland. He has chosen this crop as it is an all-season crop that has tremendous demand throughout the year as it is the staple food for the people of their region.

Therefore, Anima has requested a loan from BJS (Kiva's partner) to invest in their agribusiness. She will use the loan to purchase paddy seeds and pesticides. She hopes the loan will help her husband to offer quality products to his customers at harvest time. She emphasizes that her husband's goal is to increase his income through the farming activities so that he can develop his business, succeed as an agronomist, and have a decent life and better economic situation for himself and his family. 

Anima dreams of acquiring more lands with the profit.

She is thankful to BJS and Kiva.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers in order to grow paddy rice.

loans.name: Servete

texts.en:
Servete needs your financial help! 

She wants to buy a dairy cow since she doesn’t have one and her family needs dairy products. Up until now they have only been able to buy dairy products very rarely.
 
Servete is a 54-year-old married mother of four who lives in the rural centre of Albania. Her children range from 18 years of age to 25, with the oldest having completed local university studies while the others continue to attend schools. Her husband works in construction.

Servete works in agriculture, and she owns a bit of land where she grows corn, beans, onions, potatoes and other seasonal vegetables. In addition to this activity, she does labouring work, again in agriculture. She prepares the soil for planting, hoes and harvests plants.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow since she does not have one and the family lacks dairy products.

loans.name: Mónica

texts.en:
Monica is a Kubo Financiero’s client and this is her story:

Monica is 41 years old and is a single mother of two children. She makes a living by being a waitress in a typical Mexican restaurant and also sells catalog products such as perfumes and cosmetics.

The restaurant at which she works is located in a very famous square in Mexico City, Garibaldi; home of various mariachi shows. Monica asks for this loan to invest in her catalog products selling business. It is specifically for perfumes and cosmetics to be able to supply to her customers the amounts they demand. 

With the effort she puts into her job she aspires to be able to support her daughters and provide them with a good education.

loans.use: to stock her catalog products selling business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay her tuition fees

loans.name: Dorjpurev

texts.en:
Mr. Dorjpurev, 41 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. He has been transporting goods between districts since 2012. His wife works as janitor at a private firm. Their eldest son began studying at university. Their younger two children go to secondary school. Dorjpurev is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to pay university tuition fee for his son. He thinks that education is the way for a bright future and wants his son to study hard. 

In borrower profile picture, you can see the borrower with his son holding his admission certificate from the university.

loans.use: to pay tuition fee

loans.name: Hilda Sandra

texts.es:
Hilda es una mujer de 45 años de edad, casada, tiene una hija y su negocio es la venta de zapatos, zapatillas, bolsos y carteras.
Ella es emprendedora, decidida, fuerte, luchadora, persistente, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘villa Copacabana’ que se caracteriza por el color de los edificios que expresan una naturaleza urbana muy colorida y también por el festejo que se realiza en honor a la virgen de Copacabana, realizando una entrada folclórica con grupos musicales y bailarines.
Hilda es de tez morena, cabello castaño largo, estatura mediana, su lengua natal es el aymará, que ya no utiliza porque vive en la ciudad y la mayoría de las personas hablan español. Su trabajo es la venta de zapatos y carteras de mujer, de lunes a domingo en una pequeña tienda. La competencia con productos de muy baja calidad a menor precio ha hecho que Hilda tenga que invertir mayores recursos económicos en adquirir mejores productos y ofertarlos a precios módicos.
Ella desea incrementar sus ventas realizando la compra de zapatos brasileños a bajo costo por cambio de temporada. Su sueño es tener una tienda propia muy grande y abrir una sucursal.
Es por esos motivos que Hilda solicita un préstamo para la compra de zapatos por mayor y con los beneficios pagar los gastos escolares de su hija.
texts.en:
Hilda, 45, is married and has a daughter.  She sells shoes, sport shoes, bags and wallets for a living, and is an enterprising, determined, strong, persistent, responsible, hard-working person.  Her business is established in the "Villa Copacabana" area, known for the color of its buildings which expresses a colorful urban nature, and also for its festivities in honor of Our Lady of Copacabana, which are celebrated with musical and dance groups.

Hilda has a dark complexion and long dark hair, and is of average height.  Her mother tongue is Aymará which she does not use because she lives in the city where the majority of people speak Spanish.  Her work consists of selling shoes and women's wallets from Monday to Sunday in her small shop.  The businesses that compete with her sell lower quality products for less money which has required that Hilda invest more money in buying better products at moderate prices.

She wants to increase sales by buying Brazilian shoes at a low cost due to the change of season.  Her dream is to have her own large shop and open a second one.  Therefore, Hilda is requesting a loan to buy shoes wholesale so she can use the profit she earns to pay for her daughter's school expenses.

loans.use: To buy shoes wholesale and use the profit from sales to pay her daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Rukatmo

texts.ru:
Рукатмо в местной школе работает учительницей начальных классов. Ей 39 лет. Она занимается преподавательской деятельностью на протяжении 3 лет. Рукатмо любит школу и своих учеников, ей нравится обучать их знанию. Она профессионал своего дела.  
Рукатмо замужем, ее муж работает строителем. Они живут в столице, в городе Душанбе и ведут скромную жизнь. Рукатмо давно мечтает сделать ремонт в доме, но ей никак не удается из-за финансового недостатка. Она хочет улучшить жилищные условия и тем самым подготовиться к зиме. Для этой цели она запрашивает кредит. Рукатмо верит и надеется на финансовую поддержку.
texts.en:
Rukatmo works in a local school as an elementary school teacher. She is 39 years old. She has been working in education for the past 3 years. Rukatmo loves school and her students. She likes to educate them. She is a true teaching professional.

Rukatmo is married. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in the capital city, Dushanbe, and lead a modest life. Rukatmo has long dreamed of renovating her house but has never done it due to financial difficulties. She wants to improve her living conditions and thus prepare for winter. For this reason, she is requesting a loan. Rukatmo believes in and relies on your financial support.

loans.use: to renovate her home to improve her living conditions.

loans.name: Anecia

texts.en:
Anecia is 47 years old and has five children. She is married and all five children are in school.

She is in the agricultural business doing pig fattening in the Philippines. Anecia requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Anecia has been pig fattening for 17 years now, and has borrowed nine times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Anecia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.en:
Trinidad works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell curtain business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock to sell.

Trinidad has been in this business for 10 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock to sell

loans.name: Rosella

texts.en:
Rosella is married and she works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from eloading and frozen foods businesses. Rosella is borrowing 29,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy more stocks of groceries to sell for her general store business.

Rosella has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
As a married mother of six children, Rosalinda works hard to support her family. She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Rosalinda is borrowing 15,000 PHP through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment for her fishing business.

Rosalinda has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Jenerose

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Jenerose works hard to support her family.

She has a fish vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from buying and selling charcoal. Jenerose is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell for her fish vending business.

Jenerose has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional boxes of fish to sell.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 50 years old and married with six children, one of whom is in school. Helen works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP through NWTF to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

Helen has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future Helen would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items such as shampoo and groceries to sell.

loans.name: Placido

texts.en: Placido is an organic certified, Maya Mountain cacao farmer who lives in the beautiful village of Pueblo Viejo, in the Toledo district of southern Belize. He sees cacao farming as a beneficial long-term investment for himself and his family. Placido believes that cacao is a sustainable agricultural crop.  One that is both good for the environment and that will help develop his local community. He is requesting a Kiva loan for tidying and pruning his cacao trees. Placido is an entrepreneur and has other crops and cattle that require his time. He will hire workers to assist him. His future goal is to retire from the farm, improve his lifestyle and educate his children.

loans.use: to prune his mature cacao trees.

loans.name: Félix

texts.en:
Felix is a Kubo Financiero client and this is his story:

Felix is 46 years old and is married. He describes himself as a kind, respectful, hard-working and honest person; during his spare time he enjoys reading and listening to music.

Felix has two sources of income in order to make a living. Every day he drives a microbus, a type of public transportation unit common in Mexico, running a crowded route toward a metro station; additionally he sells clothing, and his wife helps him with this business.

He asks for this loan to invest in both of his business. His microbus needs a tire repair and the clothing-selling business needs to be stocked up. Felix looks forward to keep working and be able to have a bigger business regarding the clothes he sells and being able to buy another public transportation unit and rent it out to someone else.

loans.use: to repair his public transportation unit (micro-bus)and stock up his clothing selling business

loans.name: Radigonda

texts.en:
Radigonda works hard to support her family. Radigonda is married and has a buy and sell ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 14 years now. She requested a 30,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

In the future, Radigonda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shirts, pants, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Adjo

texts.fr: Demeurant  à  Lomé dans le quartier d’Adidogomé, Adjo  est âgée de  36 ans,  elle est mariée  avec 2 enfants en charge. Adjo   vend  des  chaussures  qu’elle achète  2 fois  par mois  au grand marché de Lomé.  Elle  les revend  par vente ambulante.  Adjo  sollicite un prêt pour agrandir  son commerce et faire plus de profit.
texts.en: Adjo has been living in the Adidogomé neighborhood of the icty of Lomé. She is 36 years old, married and has two dependent children. Adjo sells shoes. She stocks up twice a month at the big market of Lomé. She resells her merchandise as an itinerant vendor. Adjo is seeking a loan in order to expand her business and increase her profits.

loans.use: to buy 17 boxes of shoes.
